Summary: The family of missing pageant contestant Catherine Camilon is disappointed by the dismissal of the complaint filed against the suspects by the Regional Prosecutor. Despite their efforts, the legal process did not result in justice for Catherine. The family had hoped for accountability and closure, but the decision to trash the case has left them feeling let down and frustrated. They believed that the suspects should have been held accountable for their actions, especially considering the impact of Catherine's disappearance on their lives. The family is now left with unanswered questions and a sense of injustice. Despite their disappointment, they remain determined to seek justice for Catherine and to ensure that those responsible are held accountable for their actions.

Dismayado ang pamilya ng nawawalang pageant contestant na si Catherine Camilon sa pagbasura ng Regional Prosecutor sa isinampang reklamo laban sa mga suspek.

item.title: Stricter requirements for Chinese tourists to ensure travelers' rights, welfare -- Consul General
item.content:encoded: The additional visa requirements for Chinese tourists are intended to ensure that the rights and welfare of the travelers are protected, Minister and Consul General Arnel Talisayon of the Philippine Embassy in Beijing said Wednesday.

item.title: Anak, ipina-DNA test para patunayang 'di nagtaksil ang ina sa kaniyang mister
item.content:encoded:
Oton, Iloilo, mother, chismis, DNA test Summary: In Oton, Iloilo, a mother was deeply hurt by relentless gossip from neighbors claiming that her second child was not her husband's true offspring. To silence the rumors, she sought help to conduct a DNA test for the father and son. The results revealed the truth, putting an end to the malicious gossip spread by the nosy neighbors. The mother's pain and anguish over the false accusations were finally alleviated, and the family could move forward with peace and certainty. The DNA test provided concrete evidence of the father-son relationship, proving the legitimacy of their bond and shutting down the hurtful speculations. The mother's perseverance in seeking the truth paid off, restoring her dignity and reputation in the community. The family can now face the future free from the burden of baseless rumors and focus on their love and unity.

Summary:

Labis ang sakit na nararamdaman ng isang ina sa Oton, Iloilo dahil sa walang tigil na chismis ng mga kapitbahay na hindi umano tunay na anak ng kaniyang mister ang pangalawa nilang anak. Kaya para manahimik na ang mga "marites," nagpatulong siya na maipa-DNA test ang mag-ama. Alamin ang naging resulta.

item.title: Lack of 'common ground" among sectors hinder passage of Nat"l Land Use bill - solon
item.content:encoded:
bill, national law, land use, stakeholders, Marcos administration Summary: The bill seeking a national law on land use, deemed a priority measure by the Marcos administration, has encountered obstacles due to differing ideas from stakeholders. Despite efforts to push for its implementation, disagreements among various parties have stalled progress. The legislation, aimed at regulating land use across the country, has faced challenges in achieving consensus on important aspects. The involvement of different stakeholders has made it difficult to reach a unified decision on the proposed law. The diverging perspectives have hindered the bill's advancement and led to prolonged discussions without a clear resolution. The complexity of the issue and conflicting interests have created a roadblock in the development of a cohesive national framework for land use regulation.

Summary:

The bill seeking a national law on land use has been bogged down by differing ideas from various stakeholders despite being a priority measure by the Marcos administration.

item.title: PhilHealth premium should remain at 4%, says Quimbo
item.content:encoded:
PhilHealth, premium rate, 4%, earnings, limited coverage Summary: PhilHealth's premium rate should remain at 4% of a member's monthly salary, as suggested by Rep. Stella Quimbo. She argues that PhilHealth has significant earnings and insufficient coverage of healthcare expenses, making it necessary to maintain the current premium rate. Quimbo's recommendation comes in light of concerns about the sustainability and effectiveness of PhilHealth's operations. Keeping the premium rate at 4% could help ensure that members are adequately covered for their healthcare needs while also allowing PhilHealth to continue generating revenue. Overall, Quimbo's proposal aims to strike a balance between maintaining sustainable funding for PhilHealth and providing comprehensive healthcare coverage for its members.

PhilHealth's premium rate should remain at 4% of a member"s monthly salary, given its huge earnings and limited coverage of healthcare expenses, Rep. Stella Quimbo said Wednesday.

item.title: 1 Atin Ito boat has engine problem but Panatag Shoal mission continues
item.content:encoded: One of the five main boats of the Atin Ito civilian mission to the West Philippines Sea (WPS) experienced an engine problem on Wednesday, according to organizers.

item.title: Marcos: Free tertiary education in public universities, colleges to continue
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Wednesday vowed that his administration would remain committed to providing free tertiary education in public universities and colleges in the Philippines.

item.title: Mga tsuper ng PUVs na 'di sumama sa PUVMP, huhulihin na simula sa Huwebes
item.content:encoded: Inihayag ng Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) nitong Miyerkules na huhulihin na simula sa Huwebes, May 16, ang mga tsuper ng mga public utility vehicles (PUV) na hindi nagpa-consolidate sa kooperatiba.

item.title: Marcos on low PH Times University ranking: More work needs to be done
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. has called for a comprehensive strategy in the higher education sector as he lamented that no Philippine university had reached the Top 100 in the Times Higher Education's 2024 Asia University Rankings.

item.title: UP announces extended deadline for applications
item.content:encoded:
University of the Philippines; extended deadline; college applications; May 31; Summary: The University of the Philippines has decided to give students more time to submit their college applications by extending the deadline to May 31. This is a welcome relief for students who may need additional time to complete their requirements due to various reasons. The extension provides an opportunity for more students to apply and have a chance to study at the prestigious university. It also gives applicants more time to carefully review and double-check their applications to ensure they are complete and accurate. This decision shows the university's commitment to providing equal opportunities for all applicants, regardless of their circumstances. Students are encouraged to take advantage of this extended deadline and make sure to submit their applications before the new cutoff date. This move is expected to benefit both the university and the prospective students by allowing for a smoother and more inclusive admissions process.

Summary:

The University of the Philippines has extended the deadline for their college applications until May 31.

item.title: 52% ng Pinoy Gen Z, mas gustong magtrabaho sa ibang-bansa, ayon sa isang pag-aaral
item.content:encoded:
study, Filipino Gen Z, work abroad, solo work, group work Summary: A study reveals that 52% of Filipino Gen Z individuals are interested in working in a foreign country. They prefer working alone rather than in a group setting. This trend highlights a shift in mindset among the younger generation towards seeking opportunities beyond national borders. It also reflects a desire for independence and self-reliance in the workplace. The preference for solo work may indicate a focus on personal growth and autonomy, as well as a desire for flexibility and control over one's career path. As globalization continues to influence the job market, the willingness of Filipino Gen Z to work abroad suggests a readiness to explore diverse work environments and gain international experience.

Lumilitaw sa isang pag-aaral na 52 porsiyento ng mga Pinoy Gen Z ang nais na magtrabaho sa ibang bansa at mas gustong magtrabaho nang solo kaysa grupo.

item.title: SolGen looking into Mayor Guo case
item.content:encoded:
petition, questioning, rights, Bamban Mayor, possibility Summary: The Solicitor General Menardo Guevarra is considering filing a quo warranto petition to challenge the rights of Bamban Mayor Alice Guo. This move comes as a way to potentially question Guo's legitimacy in holding her position. The Solicitor General's office may seek to determine whether Guo has the legal authority to act as the Mayor of Bamban. Guevarra's office is exploring the possibility of taking legal action against Guo to address any potential concerns regarding her appointment. This action could potentially have significant implications for Guo's tenure as the Mayor of Bamban, depending on the outcome of the quo warranto petition.

Solicitor General Menardo Guevarra on Wednesday said that his office may file a quo warranto petition questioning the right of Bamban Mayor Alice Guo

item.title: LGUs ready for impact of upcoming La Niña phenomenon -- DILG exec
item.content:encoded: Local governments are ready to address the possible effects of the La Niña phenomenon in the country, an official from the Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) said on Wednesday.

item.title: PH Embassy in Beijing receives 'hate emails' amid WPS issue -- Consul General
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Embassy in Beijing has been receiving "hate emails" from anonymous Chinese citizens amid the West Philippine Sea (WPS) issue, its minister and consul general Arnel Talisayon said on Wednesday.

item.title: Gordon urges probe on Duterte after Ombudsman orders raps vs. Duque, Lao
item.content:encoded: Former Senator Dick Gordon again called for former President Rodrigo Duterte to be investigated in relation Pharmally deal.

item.title: Mga alagang aso ng dog groomer na mistulang Panda at Pikachu, pinusuan ng netizens
item.content:encoded: Pinusuan ng netizens ang mga alagang aso ng isang dog groomer, na ginayakan niya ng Panda at Pikachu sa Cebu City.

item.title: Comelec bans candidate substitution due to withdrawal after Oct. 8, 2024
item.content:encoded: The Comelec on Wednesday banned the substitution of candidates after the filing of the certificate of candidacy if the substitution will be made due to the withdrawal of the candidate.

item.title: POACC to file raps vs doctors in illegal hospital for POGO workers
item.content:encoded: The Presidential Anti-Organized Crime Commission (PAOCC) said Wednesday it will be filing criminal charges against the healthcare professionals who allegedly provide services for Philippine Offshore Gaming Operator (POGOs) workers in an illegally operating hospital in Pasay City.

item.title: PCG supports expulsion of Chinese diplomats over alleged wiretapping
item.content:encoded: PCG supports expulsion of Chinese diplomats over alleged wiretapping

item.title: Iloilo Province under state of calamity due to El Niño
item.content:encoded: The Province of Iloilo is placed under a state of calamity on May 14, 2024 because of the El Niño phenomenon.

item.title: Lucban, Quezon, ipinagdiriwang ang Pahiyas Festival 2024
item.content:encoded:
Lucban, Quezon, Pahiyas Festival, colorful, May 15

Pahiyas Festival is celebrated in Lucban, Quezon on May 15. The festival is known for its colorful and extravagant decorations made from fruits, vegetables, and rice grains displayed on houses and along the streets. Local residents showcase their creativity and artistry in creating these vibrant displays to honor San Isidro Labrador, the patron saint of farmers. The festival also features a street parade, live music, traditional dances, and a culinary tour highlighting local delicacies. Visitors from all over the Philippines and around the world come to witness the festive atmosphere and experience the rich cultural heritage of Lucban. The Pahiyas Festival is not only a time of celebration and merrymaking but also a time to give thanks for a bountiful harvest and to ask for blessings for the coming year. Despite its origins as a religious celebration, the festival has evolved into a major tourist attraction, drawing in thousands of visitors annually.

Summary: Pahiyas Festival in Lucban, Quezon on May 15 is a vibrant celebration of art, culture, and thanksgiving, featuring colorful decorations, traditional performances, and culinary delights, attracting visitors from near and far.

Ipinagdiriwang ngayong Miyerkoles, Mayo 15, sa bayan ng Lucban, Quezon ang kanilang makulay at magarbong Pahiyas Festival.

item.title: Hostel owner, nagalit umano nang gamitin ng isang transgender woman ang CR ng mga babae
item.content:encoded:
transgender woman, hostel owner, confrontation, viral video, Legazpi City Summary: A transgender woman in Legazpi City sparked controversy after a confrontation with the owner of the hostel she was staying in for using the women's restroom. The incident was caught on video and quickly went viral on social media platforms. The video shows the heated exchange between the transgender woman and the hostel owner, who insisted that she use the men's restroom instead. The transgender woman argued that she identifies as female and felt more comfortable using the women's restroom. The incident reignited discussions about transgender rights and inclusion in public spaces. The confrontation highlighted the ongoing struggle for acceptance and understanding of the LGBTQ+ community in society. The incident serves as a reminder of the discrimination and challenges faced by transgender individuals in their daily lives.

Nag-viral ang video ng pakikipagtalo ng isang transgender woman sa lalaking may-ari ng tinutuluyan niyang hostel matapos niyang gamitin ang CR ng mga babae sa Legazpi City.

item.title: PCG sends more ships as Chinese vessels seen amid PH WPS civilian mission
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Coast Guard, deployed, ships, monitor, Scarborough Shoal
Summary: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) has deployed two additional ships to monitor the safety of a civilian mission to Scarborough Shoal in the West Philippine Sea (WPS). The deployment aims to ensure the safety and security of the mission in the disputed waters. The PCG's presence will help in monitoring any potential threats and providing assistance to the civilians participating in the mission. The move highlights the government's commitment to protecting its citizens and asserting its sovereignty in the region. The Scarborough Shoal, also known as Bajo de Masinloc, has been a point of contention between the Philippines and China, with both countries claiming ownership of the area. The PCG's deployment serves as a proactive measure to prevent any incidents and safeguard the interests of the Philippines in the WPS.

The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Wednesday deployed two additional ships to monitor the safety of the civilian mission to Scarborough Shoal (Bajo de Masinloc) in the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

item.title: Symbolic markers within EEZ installed in PH WPS civilian mission
item.content:encoded: Symbolic markers were successfully placed within the Philippine exclusive economic zone (EEZ) during the civilian mission of the Atin Ito Coalition on Wednesday.

item.title: Underground clinic raided in Pasay allegedly involved in abortion practices -- BI
item.content:encoded: The recently raided underground clinic in Pasay City was also allegedly involved in abortion practices, the Bureau of Immigration (BI) said Wednesday.

item.title: Lawmaker: Some Chinese tourists converting to student visa to extend stay in PH
item.content:encoded: Surigao del Norte lawmaker Ace Barbers on Wednesday expressed alarm over reports that some Chinese individuals are converting to student visas.

item.title: DepEd reminds youth: Vaping not a necessity nor an accessory
item.content:encoded: BANGKOK, Thailand -- The Department of Education (DepEd) is urging the Filipino youth not to consider electronic cigarettes or vapor products a necessity or an accessory.

item.title: Visayas Grid under yellow alert anew on Wednesday
item.content:encoded: The Visayas Grid will be placed under yellow alert for the third straight day on Wednesday, as over 20 power plants are either on forced outage or running on derated capacities.

item.title: Task force urges arrested suspect in Kidapawan broadcaster's slay to confess
item.content:encoded:
arrested suspect, murder, broadcaster, cooperation, admit Summary: The Presidential Task Force on Media Security (PTFoMS) has urged the arrested suspect in the 2019 murder of broadcaster Eduardo "Ed" Dizon in Kidapawan City, North Cotabato to cooperate with authorities and confess to shooting the victim. The suspect is being called upon to provide information and assist in the investigation process. It is crucial for the suspect to take responsibility for the crime and reveal any accomplices involved in the heinous act. By admitting to the shooting, the suspect can help bring closure to the case and serve justice for the victim and his family. The PTFoMS emphasizes the importance of transparency and accountability in media-related crimes, and the suspect's cooperation is essential in ensuring a fair and thorough legal process.

The Presidential Task Force on Media Security (PTFoMS) has called on the arrested suspect in the 2019 murder of broadcaster Eduardo "Ed" Dizon in Kidapawan City, North Cotabato to cooperate with authorities and admit to shooting the victim.

item.title: Sangkatutak na alamang na ibinuga ng butanding, pinagkaguluhan sa Aurora
item.content:encoded:
butanding, alamang, sangkatutak, Casiguran, Aurora Summary: Residents in Casiguran, Aurora, were treated to a feast of a large amount of shrimp-like creatures regurgitated by a whale shark that had washed ashore. The residents gathered around to witness the extraordinary sight as the whale shark vomited out a multitude of tiny shrimp known as alamang along the shoreline. The event attracted a crowd of onlookers curious about the phenomenon of a whale shark expelling a vast quantity of marine life. The residents took the opportunity to collect the alamang, which were described as a delicacy in the region and a popular seafood item. The incident served as a unique and memorable experience for the locals, who marveled at the rare occurrence and made the most of the unexpected gift from the ocean.

Pinagpiyestahan ng mga residente ang sangkatutak na alamang na ibinuga ng isang butanding na napadpad sa sa dalampasigan sa Casiguran, Aurora.

item.title: Parts of Paranaque, Cavite, Laguna to experience power interruptions on May 16, 17
item.content:encoded:
Paranaque City, Cavite, Laguna, power service interruptions, scheduled maintenance

Summary: Parts of Paranaque City, Cavite, and Laguna will experience power service interruptions on May 16 and 17 due to scheduled maintenance activities. Residents in these areas are advised to make necessary preparations for the temporary power outage. The scheduled maintenance activities aim to improve the overall reliability and efficiency of the electrical system in the said areas. It is recommended for residents to unplug appliances and devices during the specified time to avoid damage or electrical surges once the power is restored. Alternative power sources or arrangements should be made in advance to minimize inconvenience during the scheduled outage. People are urged to stay updated on the maintenance schedules provided by the local power utility to mitigate any potential disruptions. It is important for residents to cooperate and follow safety guidelines issued during the maintenance period to ensure a smooth process and prevent any accidents or incidents.

Parts of Paranaque City, Cavite, and Laguna will experience power service interruptions on May 16 and 17 due to scheduled maintenance activities.

item.title: Construction worker arestado sa panghahalay umano ng 12-anyos na pinsan
item.content:encoded: Hinuli ang isang construction worker sa Quezon City dahil sa panggagahasa umano sa kaniyang 12-anyos na pinsan, ayon sa ulat ni GMA Integrated News reporter James Agustin sa Unang Balita nitong Miyerkoles.

item.title: Sekyu sa QC arestado sa panggagahasa umano sa 16-anyos na anak
item.content:encoded: Inaresto ang isang security guard sa Quezon City matapos umanong gahasain ang kaniyang 16-anyos na anak na babae.

item.title: $587M worth of drugs seized in first 2 years of Marcos admin -- Abalos
item.content:encoded: Some US$587 million worth of illegal drugs have been seized during the Marcos administration's first two years, according to Interior and Local Government Secretary Benhur Abalos.

item.title: IRR for amnesty proclamations released
item.content:encoded: The National Amnesty Commission has released the Implementing Rules and Regulations for the amnesty application of former rebels.

item.title: Marcos welcomes non-resident envoys to strengthen ties with other countries
item.content:encoded:
Ambassadors-designate, Belarus, Ghana, Turkmenistan, Malta, Dominican Republic
Summary:
President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. received the non-resident ambassadors-designate of Belarus, Ghana, Turkmenistan, Malta, Dominican Republic, and Nicaragua. The ambassadors represented their respective countries in the welcoming event. President Marcos expressed his appreciation for their commitment to strengthening diplomatic ties with the Philippines. The meeting aimed to enhance cooperation and bilateral relations between the Philippines and the six countries. The ambassadors discussed areas of mutual interest and potential collaborations in various fields, including trade, investment, culture, and education. President Marcos emphasized the importance of maintaining open communication and fostering partnerships for the benefit of all nations involved.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. welcomed on Tuesday non-resident ambassadors-designate of Belarus, Ghana, Turkmenistan, Malta, Dominican Republic, and Nicaragua.

item.title: LTFRB to start flagging down drivers of unconsolidated PUVs on Thursday
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Land Transportation Franchising Regulatory Board, jeepney drivers, consolidate, PUVs, cooperatives Summary: The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board will start apprehending jeepney drivers on May 16 who have not consolidated their public utility vehicles (PUVs) into cooperatives. This move aims to implement the government's PUV Modernization Program, which includes the consolidation of PUVs to improve efficiency and service quality. By requiring drivers to join cooperatives, the LTFRB aims to streamline operations and ensure better regulation of the public transportation sector. Failure to comply with the consolidation requirement may result in penalties or sanctions for non-compliant drivers. This initiative is part of the board's efforts to modernize the country's public transportation system and provide a more organized and reliable service for commuters.

Summary:

Starting May 16, the Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board will begin apprehending jeepney drivers who failed to consolidate their PUVs into cooperatives.

item.title: PH gov't vows commitment to equitable international order
item.content:encoded:
Philippine government, dedicated, peaceful, equitable, international order

The Philippine government, aiming for a non-permanent seat on the United Nations Security Council (UNSC), pledged its commitment to upholding a peaceful and fair global system. Emphasizing the importance of promoting peace and equality on the international stage, the government assured that it would prioritize these principles if elected to the UNSC. Recognizing the significant influence wielded by the UNSC in global affairs, the Philippines vowed to actively contribute to maintaining stability and cooperation among nations. By advocating for a peaceful and equitable international order, the government aims to foster stronger diplomatic ties and partnerships with countries around the world. Through its participation in the UNSC, the Philippines seeks to play a constructive role in addressing critical global challenges and advancing the goals of peace and security.

Summary: The Philippine government is dedicated to promoting peace and equity in the international arena, with a focus on upholding these values if elected to a non-permanent seat on the UNSC.

The Philippine government vowed to remain dedicated to a peaceful and equitable international order once elected to a non-permanent seat at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC).

item.title: 5, patay sa karambola ng 3 sasakyan sa Lopez, Quezon
item.content:encoded: Patay ang limang katao sa aksidenteng naganap sa Maharlika Highway, Canda Ilaya, Lopez, Quezon nitong Miyerkoles ng madaling araw.

item.title: PH civilian mission sets sail for Scarborough Shoal in WPS
item.content:encoded:
departure, Zambales, mission, Scarborough Shoal, West Philippine Sea Summary:
Around 100 boats departed from Zambales for a civilian mission to Scarborough Shoal in the West Philippine Sea on Wednesday morning. The mission aimed to assert the Philippines' sovereignty over the shoal, also known as Bajo de Masinloc. The boats carried a group of civilians, including fishermen and activists, who were determined to reach the disputed area despite the risks involved. The mission highlighted the ongoing territorial disputes in the region and the Philippines' efforts to protect its maritime claims. The departure of the boats symbolized the determination of the participants to raise awareness about the importance of Scarborough Shoal to the Philippines and to push for peaceful resolutions to the territorial conflicts in the West Philippine Sea.
Summary:

Around 100 boats departed from Zambales early Wednesday morning for a civilian mission to Scarborough Shoal or Bajo de Masinloc in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: North Korean leader oversees tactical missile weapons system, KCNA says
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: North Korean leader, Kim Jong Un, tactical missile weapons system, newly installed, army Summary: Kim Jong Un, the North Korean leader, recently oversaw the inspection of a tactical missile weapons system that is set to be installed at missile units within the country's army. The state media KCNA reported on Wednesday about this development. This shows Kim Jong Un's continued interest and involvement in the country's military activities, highlighting his focus on its defense capabilities. The new missile system is expected to enhance the army's readiness and capabilities in handling potential threats. This move aligns with North Korea's ongoing efforts to strengthen its military arsenal and maintain a strong defense posture. Kim Jong Un's supervision of this tactical missile system installation also signifies his direct authority over the country's military operations, reinforcing his control and influence in national defense strategies.

North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on Tuesday oversaw a tactical missile weapons system that will be newly installed at missile units of its army, state media KCNA reported on Wednesday.

item.title: 52% of Pinoy Gen Zs prefer to work abroad, says study
item.content:encoded:
study, Pinoy Gen Zs, work abroad, culture, personal growth Summary: The study by a health insurance provider reveals that at least 52% of Pinoy Gen Z individuals prefer to work abroad, while 48% choose to stay in the country. The PhilCare Wellness Index indicates that Gen Zs, born between 1997 and 2015, seek new cultural experiences and personal growth to enhance their competitiveness in the global job market. This desire for international work opportunities reflects their aspiration for broader horizons and development. With a focus on increasing their marketability and skill set through exposure to diverse environments, these young Filipinos are motivated to explore professional opportunities outside their home country.

At least 52 % of Pinoy Gen Zs prefer to work abroad while 48% opt to stay in the country, according to the study of a health insurance provide. In the report of EJ Gomez on "Saksi," the PhilCare Wellness Index: An updated ABC of Pinoy Gen X, Y, and Z study shows that Gen Zs or individuals born between 1997 and 2015 want to experience new culture and personal growth that will also increase their competitiveness and marketability in the global job market.

item.title: Florida bus crash kills eight, leaves eight in critical condition
item.content:encoded:
collision, bus, farm laborers, fatalities, critical injuries
At least eight people were killed and eight others critically injured in a collision involving a bus carrying farm laborers and a pickup truck in northern Florida on Tuesday. The bus overturned after the crash, resulting in a tragic and deadly accident. The bus was carrying a group of farm laborers at the time of the collision, and the pickup truck was also involved in the accident. Emergency responders worked quickly to assist the injured and transport them to nearby hospitals for medical treatment. The incident highlights the importance of road safety and the potential dangers of transportation accidents, especially for individuals working in the agricultural industry. Authorities are investigating the cause of the crash in order to determine what led to the fatal collision. The community is mourning the loss of those who were killed in the accident and offers condolences to the families and loved ones of the victims.

Summary:

A bus carrying farm laborers in northern Florida collided with a pickup truck on Tuesday and overturned, killing at least eight people and critically injuring eight others, authorities said.

item.title: CBCP calls on dioceses to observe 'Day of Conscience'
item.content:encoded:
Dioceses, "International Day of Conscience", June 16, Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) President, Pablo Virgilio David Summary: - Dioceses are encouraged to participate in the observance of "International Day of Conscience" on June 16, as suggested by CBCP President Pablo Virgilio David. - The Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) is promoting the commemoration of the "International Day of Conscience" and urges dioceses to join in. - The observance of this day highlights the significance of acting in accordance with one’s conscience and ethical principles. - By participating in this worldwide event, dioceses can reinforce the values of conscience and moral decision-making. - The initiative seeks to raise awareness and promote reflection on the importance of conscience in guiding individuals towards ethical actions.


Dioceses are encouraged to join the observance of "International Day of Conscience" on June 16, according to Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP) President Pablo Virgilio David.

item.title: Mga dambuhalang mangga sa Nueva Ecija, aabot sa 1 hanggang 3 kilo ang isang piraso
item.content:encoded:
mangoes, Guimba, Nueva Ecija, size, weight Summary: Mangoes grown in a farm in Guimba, Nueva Ecija cannot be underestimated, as they can grow up to 10 inches in size and weigh between one to three kilograms each. The large size and weight of these mangoes showcase the quality and robustness of the fruits produced in the area. Guimba in Nueva Ecija is known for its bountiful harvests of mangoes, with some reaching impressive dimensions. Farmers take pride in cultivating these fruits, ensuring that they are nurtured to their full potential. The farm in Guimba stands out for their dedication to producing premium mangoes that are both sizeable and flavorful. The mangoes from this region are sought after for their exceptional taste and remarkable size, making them a staple in the local agriculture industry.

Hindi puwedeng maliitin ang mga mangga na itinataim sa isang farm sa Guimban, Nueva Ecija dahil umaabot ang laki nito sa 10 pulgada at nasa isa hanggang tatlong kilo ang bigat ng isang piraso.

item.title: Man nabbed for alleged rape of 15-year-old neighbor
item.content:encoded:
neighbor, arrested, workplace, Dasmariñas, Cavite, rape Summary: A man was arrested at his workplace in Dasmariñas, Cavite, for allegedly raping his 15-year-old neighbor. The incident took place in the said neighborhood where the victim and the suspect lived. The suspect was taken into custody by the police after the victim reported the crime. The 15-year-old girl bravely spoke up about the assault, leading to the prompt arrest of the perpetrator. The authorities conducted an investigation and gathered evidence to support the victim's claims. The suspect is facing charges related to the sexual assault of a minor. The community expressed shock and concern over the incident, emphasizing the need for justice to be served. The arrest serves as a reminder of the importance of reporting such crimes and holding perpetrators accountable for their actions.

Police have arrested a man at his workplace in Dasmariñas, Cavite after allegedly raping his 15-year-old neighbor.

item.title: Walang kuryente o walang tubig: Ano ang mas pipiliin mo?
item.content:encoded: Ngayong matindi ang init ng panahon, ano kaya ang mas gugustuhin ng mga tao na isakripisyo: ang mawalan ng tubig o mawalan ng kuryente?

item.title: Binatilyong estudyante, minolestiya umano ng lalaki niyang guro sa loob ng elem school sa Pangasinan
item.content:encoded:
arrested, teacher, 12-year-old student, molested, classroom Summary: A male teacher was arrested after a 12-year-old male student accused him of molesting him inside a classroom in Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan. The incident took place at the said location, leading to the teacher's arrest by authorities. The teacher's alleged misconduct was reported by the young student, prompting the swift action of law enforcement. This case highlights the vulnerability of students and the importance of vigilance in educational settings to prevent such occurrences. The teacher now faces legal consequences for his actions, and the student will receive necessary support and assistance to cope with the trauma inflicted upon him. The incident serves as a reminder of the duty of teachers to provide a safe and nurturing environment for their students, free from any form of abuse or misconduct.

Summary:

Arestado ang isang lalaking guro matapos magsumbong ang kaniyang 12-anyos na lalaking estudyante na minolestiya umano niya sa loob ng silid-aralan sa Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan.

item.title: 'I am Alice Guo... a Filipino citizen'
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Ian Cruz, report, Guo, proclamation rally, Filipino citizen Summary: Ian Cruz's report on "24 Oras" discussed Guo's statement at her proclamation rally on April 2, 2022, where she claimed to be a Filipino citizen. This proclamation rally served as a platform for Guo to assert her connection to the Philippines and garner support for her candidacy. The announcement of her citizenship is significant in the context of the upcoming elections, as it establishes her eligibility to run for public office in the country. Guo's declaration could potentially impact public perception of her candidacy and influence voter decisions in the election. The statement made by Guo at the rally underscores her commitment to the Philippines and suggests that she is invested in the country's future. Overall, Guo's assertion of her Filipino citizenship is a notable development in the political landscape leading up to the elections.

According to Ian Cruz's report on "24 Oras," Guo said at her proclamation rally on April 2, 2022, that she was a Filipino citizen.

item.title: Award-winning Pinoy scientist, napiling maging speaker sa Harvard climate conference
item.content:encoded:
Scientist, Glenn Banaguas, Harvard Climate Action Week, Pilipino, award-winning Summary: Glenn Banaguas, an award-winning scientist from the Philippines, has been invited to speak at the upcoming Harvard Climate Action Week in June. He is the only Filipino to receive this invitation, highlighting his expertise and contributions to climate science. Banaguas' presence at the event signifies international recognition of his work in addressing climate change. As a champion for environmental sustainability, his insights and research are expected to make a significant impact on the global conversation around climate action. Banaguas' participation at Harvard Climate Action Week serves as an inspiration for other Filipino scientists to showcase their expertise on a prestigious platform, raising awareness about the importance of environmental conservation and the role of researchers in combating climate change.

Ang award-winning scientist na si Glenn Banaguas ang tanging Pilipino na naimbitahan na magsalita sa upcoming Harvard Climate Action Week sa Hunyo.

item.title: Death toll from South African building collapse rises to 33
item.content:encoded: The death toll from a building collapse in the South African city of George last week rose to 33 on Tuesday as rescuers continued to comb through the rubble with 19 people still unaccounted for.

item.title: Customs seize P791-M worth of illegal cigarettes, vapes from SG
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Customs - Manila International Container Port on Tuesday seized three containers of illegal cigarettes and vape products from Singapore with an estimated amount of P791 million.

item.title: 4 suspects arrested in annulment scam
item.content:encoded: Four targets were arrested by the National Bureau of Investigation - Cybercrime Division for allegedly offering to process late birth registration and annulment without a court appearance.

item.title: 166 Chinese from Bamban POGO deported
item.content:encoded: Some 166 Chinese citizens who allegedly who worked illegally at a Philippine offshore gaming operator (POGO) hub in Bamban, Tarlac were deported on Tuesday.

item.title: Nursing board topnotcher honors parents
item.content:encoded: A graduate of St. Jude College-Dasmariñas in Cavite, who topped the 2024 Nurses Licensure Examination (NLE) paid tribute to her parents, whom she said served as her inspiration on her journey.  Abigail Cayanan, 22, bested 7,749 examinees as she emerged as the topnotcher of the 2024 NLE after scoring 92.60%.

item.title: No winners of major lotto draws on Tuesday, May 14, 2024
item.content:encoded: There were no winners of any of the three big lotto draws held on Tuesday, May 14, 2024.

item.title: Tobacco use down, but vaping up among youth --DOH
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: tobacco decline, Philippines, electric cigarette, vape, youth Summary: The Department of Health in the Philippines has noted a decline in tobacco usage over the past decade, but there has been a significant increase in the use of electric cigarettes and vape products, especially among young people aged 13-15. This trend is concerning as it indicates a shift towards potentially harmful alternatives to traditional tobacco products. The rise in electric cigarette and vape usage among the youth raises health concerns and highlights the need for stricter regulations and prevention programs to combat this emerging trend. The government must take action to address this issue and protect the health of the younger generation.

Although the use of tobacco has declined in the Philippines for over ten years, electric cigarette and vape usage has increased, particularly among the youth aged 13-15 years old, the Department of Health said Tuesday.

item.title: Ilocos norte well reeks of gasoline
item.content:encoded:
Barangay 5, Ilocos Norte, San Nicolas town, residents, water contamination
Summary: Residents of Barangay 5 in Ilocos Norte's San Nicolas town have been facing water contamination issues for several months. The well water was found to have a greenish color and a strong gasoline odor, making it unusable for drawing water. This situation has caused inconvenience and raised concerns among the residents who rely on the well for their water needs. Authorities have been contacted to investigate the source of the contamination and take necessary actions to address the issue promptly. The community is eagerly awaiting a resolution to this problem to ensure access to clean and safe water for their daily needs.

For the past several months, residents of Barangay 5 in Ilocos Norte's San Nicolas town have been unable to draw water from their well as the water had a greenish color and reeked of gasoline.

item.title: China Coast Guard conducts exercise prior to Filipino civilian convoy to Panatag Shoal
item.content:encoded:
China Coast Guard, exercise, Filipino civilian convoy, Panatag Shoal, supplies

Summary: The China Coast Guard conducted an exercise a day prior to the expected arrival of a Filipino civilian convoy at the Panatag Shoal. The convoy is scheduled to deliver supplies to local fishermen. The exercise raised concerns about potential tensions or conflicts between the Chinese authorities and the Filipino convoy. It signifies the ongoing territorial disputes in the region, particularly regarding the contested waters around the Panatag Shoal. The presence of the China Coast Guard exercise could potentially impact the smooth delivery of supplies to the local fishermen, highlighting the delicate geopolitical situation in the area. The exercise also underscores the complex dynamics between China and the Philippines in the South China Sea. Despite these tensions, the Filipino convoy remains determined to fulfill its mission of delivering much-needed supplies to the fishermen at the Panatag Shoal. This situation emphasizes the ongoing challenges and complexities in the maritime disputes in the region.

The China Coast Guard conducted an exercise a day before a Filipino civilian convoy is set to arrive at the Panatag Shoal to deliver supplies to local fishermen.

item.title: Teacher nabbed for allegedly molesting Grade 6 student in Pangasinan
item.content:encoded: A public school teacher was apprehended in Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan, for allegedly molesting a 12-year-old student.

item.title: 'Vampire facial' o paggamit ng sariling dugo upang kuminis ang balat, ligtas kaya?
item.content:encoded: Kung facial mask at peels, ang ginagamit sa ibang facial procedure, ibahin ang "vampire facial" dahil sariling dugo ng pasyente ang ginagamit para mapakinis ang kaniyang balat. Ligtas naman kaya ito?

item.title: Speaker Romualdez meets Cabinet officials, calls for speedy La Niña preps
item.content:encoded: Speaker Martin Romualdez called on government agencies to ramp up preparations for the La Niña to prevent deaths and mitigate property damage.

item.title: Midyear bonus ng mga gov't worker, matatanggap na simula sa Miyerkules, May 15 --DBM
item.content:encoded:
DBM, mid-year bonus, government personnel, one month salary, May 15 Summary: DBM announced that starting on Wednesday, May 15, qualified government employees will receive their mid-year bonus equivalent to one month's salary. This bonus is a form of recognition for their hard work and dedication in serving the public. The mid-year bonus is a much-awaited incentive that will help boost morale and provide additional financial support to government personnel. It serves as a reward for their contributions to public service and encourages them to continue performing their duties efficiently. Overall, the mid-year bonus is a way for the government to show appreciation and support for its employees during the middle of the year.

Simula sa Miyerkules, May 15, makatatanggap na ng mid-year bonus ang mga qualified government personnel na katumbas ng isang buwang sahod, ayon sa Department of Budget and Management (DBM).

item.title: Lightning strike kills 2 soldiers, injures 4 in Kalinga
item.content:encoded:
soldiers, died, lightning, security operation, Kalinga Summary: Two soldiers died and four others were injured after being struck by lightning during a security operation in the town of Lubuagan, Kalinga. The incident occurred while the soldiers were carrying out their duties, resulting in a tragic loss of life. The unexpected lightning strike caused chaos and devastation, leaving the surviving soldiers with injuries. The town of Lubuagan is now in mourning for the soldiers who lost their lives in the line of duty. This tragic event serves as a reminder of the dangers faced by military personnel, even during routine operations. The community is coming together to support the families of the deceased soldiers and offer assistance to those who were injured in the incident.

Two soldiers died while four others were injured after they were struck by lightning during a security operation in the town of Lubuagan in Kalinga, it was reported Tuesday.

item.title: Beyond Honor and Excellence: University of the Philippines' new motto unveiled
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: University of the Philippines, motto, update, "Honor and Excellence" Summary: The University of the Philippines (UP) has recently revamped its timeless motto, "Honor and Excellence." The new motto, "Honor and Excellence in the Service of the People," aims to better reflect the university's commitment to serving the Filipino people. This update highlights UP's dedication not only to academic excellence but also to making a positive impact on society. By incorporating the phrase "in the Service of the People," UP emphasizes its role in nation-building and advancing the welfare of the community. This change underscores the university's core values of honor and excellence, while also emphasizing the importance of social responsibility and service. Overall, the updated motto serves as a reminder of UP's mission to contribute meaningfully to the development and progress of the Philippines.

Summary: The University of the Philippines has revised its motto from "Honor and Excellence" to "Honor and Excellence in the Service of the People," to underscore its commitment to serving the Filipino community and fostering social responsibility alongside academic excellence.

The University of the Philippines (UP) has updated its time-honored motto of "Honor and Excellence."

item.title: Israeli forces back in northern Gaza as doubts over war aims grow
item.content:encoded: Israeli troops are back in northern Gaza, in areas that were supposed to have been cleared months ago, highlighting growing questions about Israel's declared goal of eliminating Hamas.

item.title: Marcos hails LTO for addressing zero backlog on license plates, cards
item.content:encoded: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. praised the Land Transportation Office (LTO) as the agency is en route to achieving a zero backlog when it comes to license plates and cards.

item.title: Tulfo seeks assurance of no power outages during 2025 polls
item.content:encoded: Senator Raffy Tulfo on Tuesday sought assurance from the Department of Energy (DOE) that there would be no power interruptions during the 2025 national and local elections.

item.title: Negosyong 'Thicc Treats' na swak sa tag-init, kumikita ng hanggang P10K kada araw?
item.content:encoded: Patok lalo na sa mga estudyante ang palamig na Thicc Treats ng isang mag-asawa na may iba"t ibang nakakatakam na flavor ngayong tag-init sa Maynila. Ang kanilang negosyong mahigit isang dekada na, kumikita ng hanggang P10,000 kada araw.

item.title: Bong Revilla's Achilles tendon surgery wound reopens
item.content:encoded: Senator Ramon "Bong" Revilla Jr. on Tuesday revealed that his Achilles tendon surgery wound has reopened, prompting him to continue his attendance in Senate sessions virtually.

item.title: Remulla orders NBI to probe illegal activities of foreign diplomats
item.content:encoded:
alleged recordings, disputes, West Philippine Sea, Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla, National Bureau of Investigation Summary:

Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla has ordered the National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) to investigate alleged illegal and unlawful activities committed by foreign diplomats amidst recordings regarding disputes in the West Philippine Sea. The NBI will be looking into any violations of Philippine laws by foreign diplomats in the country. This move comes as tensions in the West Philippine Sea continue to escalate, with various countries asserting their claims over the disputed waters. The Philippines has been vocal about protecting its sovereign rights in the region and ensuring that international laws are upheld. The investigation aims to ensure that all parties involved in the disputes adhere to the proper legal protocols and prevent any further escalation of tensions in the area.

Amid alleged recordings concerning disputes in the West Philippine Sea, Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla has ordered the National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) to probe illegal and unlawful activities committed by foreign diplomats.

item.title: NSC urges Congress to support fast-tracked AFP modernization
item.content:encoded:
National Security Council, Senate, House of Representatives, modernization, Philippine military Summary: The National Security Council (NSC) appealed to the Senate and House of Representatives for support in fast-tracking the modernization of the Philippine military. The NSC emphasized the urgency of modernizing the military to address emerging security threats and protect the country's interests. The appeal underscores the importance of enhancing the capabilities and readiness of the Philippine armed forces to effectively respond to evolving challenges in the region. The NSC's call for support from lawmakers highlights the need for sustained efforts in upgrading equipment, technology, and training for the military. This initiative aims to ensure that the Philippine military remains capable of safeguarding national security and promoting peace and stability in the country and the region.

The National Security Council (NSC) on Tuesday appealed to the Senate and the House of Representatives to support programs fast-tracking the modernization of the Philippine military.

item.title: Rice fund raised to P15B as House OKs rice tariff amendments
item.content:encoded:
House of Representatives, amendments, Rice Tariffication law, farmers, productivity Summary: - The House of Representatives approved amendments to the Rice Tariffication law to provide additional support to farmers and help increase their productivity. - The amendments aim to boost assistance to farmers in the rice sector. - The proposed changes seek to help improve the income and competitiveness of Filipino farmers. - By implementing these amendments, the government hopes to provide a more conducive environment for farmers to thrive. - The decision to enhance the Rice Tariffication law reflects the government's commitment to uplift the agricultural sector and promote sustainable development.

Summary:

The House of Representatives on Tuesday approved on second reading amendments to the Rice Tariffication law to boost support to farmers and help increase their productivity.

item.title: PUVMP rolls on as SC orders DOTr, LTFRB to comment on petition
item.content:encoded: The Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program (PUVMP) remains in effect as the Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday ordered the Department of Transportation (DOTr) and the Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board  (LTFRB) to comment on the amended petition filed against the program.

item.title: PH, US will expand space tech collab to monitor West Philippine Sea
item.content:encoded: The Philippine and United States on Tuesday (Philippines time) said they are planning to boost their cooperation in using space technology to monitor and document vessels in the West Philippine Sea (WPS).

item.title: PH Navy warship, nasa Escoda Shoal; gagawa ng artipisyal na isla, 'di papayagan
item.content:encoded: Sa harap ng hinala na nagpaplano na naman ang China na gumawa ng artipisyal na isla sa Escoda o Sabina Shoal na sakop ng teritoryo ng Pilipinas, ipinadala doon ng Philippine Navy ang isa nilang warship.

item.title: Mother's Day tribute video ni Isabelle Daza sa inang si Gloria Diaz, kinagiliwan
item.content:encoded: Kinaaliwan at relate ang netizens sa Mother"s Day tribute video ni Isabelle Daza para kay Gloria Diaz dahil makikitang iba ang pagtrato nito sa mga apo kumpara sa pagdisiplina nito sa kaniya bilang isang ina.

item.title: Remulla on investment 'scam' probe: Charge the guilty
item.content:encoded: Justice Secretary Jesus Crispin Remulla on Tuesday ordered prosecutors to look closely at the complaint filed against the Maria Francesca Tan (MFT) Group of Companies Inc. and Foundry Ventures I Inc. over an illegal investment scheme.

item.title: Comelec submits Bamban mayor Alice Guo's 2022 candidacy docs to Senate panel
item.content:encoded: The Commission on Elections (Comelec) has submitted to the Senate committee on women, children, family relations and gender equality the Certificate of Candidacy (COC) and Statement of Contributions and Expenditures (SOCE) of Bamban, Tarlac mayor Alice Guo.

item.title: LP, iniwan na ni ex-Sen. Bam Aquino; lumipat sa KANP na miyembro si Chel Diokno
item.content:encoded: Kumalas na sa Liberal Party (LP) si dating senador Paolo Benigno "Bam" Aquino IV, at lumipat sa Katipunan ng Nagkakaisang Pilipino (KANP) na itinatag noon lang 2021.

item.title: Over 100 show cause orders issued vs license plate dealers -LTO
item.content:encoded: LTO chief Atty. Vigor Mendoza said more than 100 show-cause orders were issued against dealers asking them to explain why there was a delay in the release of license plates.

item.title: DA urged to look into 'rejects' imported hybrid seedlings
item.content:encoded: The Department of Agriculture (DA) has been urged to look into reports that imported hybrid seedlings being distributed to local farmers were "rejects."

item.title: Ginang, patay matapos tagain sa leeg ng kaniyang kinakasama dahil umano sa selos
item.content:encoded: Nasawi ang isang babaeng 57-anyos matapos siyang tagain sa leeg ng kaniyang kinakasama na 69-anyos sa Tuburan, Cebu. Ang kanilang anak, kritikal din.

item.title: Social Media group files complaint over Marcos deepfakes
item.content:encoded:
broadcasters, social media, complaint, deepfakes, President Marcos Jr. Summary: A group of social media broadcasters filed a complaint on Tuesday against online accounts that shared deepfakes of President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. The complaint specifically targets those responsible for disseminating the manipulated videos online. The broadcasters are concerned about the spread of false information through deepfake technology and are taking action to combat its impact on public perception. The complaint highlights the potential harm caused by sharing fake content of political figures and the need for stricter regulations regarding deepfakes. The group aims to hold the individuals behind the dissemination of the deepfakes accountable for their actions and prevent further misuse of this technology for malicious purposes.

Summary:

A group of social media broadcasters on Tuesday filed a complaint against several online accounts that shared deepfakes of President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr.

item.title: DepEd set on June school opening in 2025
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Department of Education, reduce, school days, Saturdays, old academic calendar Summary: The Department of Education plans to reduce the number of school days and schedule classes on Saturdays for the current academic year. This move is part of its efforts to revert to the old academic calendar by the following school year. The department aims to streamline the academic calendar and provide a more efficient and effective learning environment for students. By adjusting the schedule and incorporating Saturday classes, the Department of Education hopes to improve student performance and overall academic outcomes. This aggressive push towards the old academic calendar signifies a shift in education policies and practices to adapt to the changing needs of students and educators.

Summary:

The Department of Education is expected to reduce the number of school days and hold classes for several Saturdays for the current school year amid its "aggressive" push to revert to the old academic calendar by next school year.

item.title: Sangkatutak na blue jellyfish, dumagsa sa baybayin ng Butuan City
item.content:encoded:
Butuan City, Agusan del Norte, blue jellyfish, bungkakol, danger, livelihood disruption

Blue jellyfish, known as "bungkakol," have been appearing in large numbers along the shores of Butuan City, Agusan del Norte. While they are a beautiful sight to behold, their presence poses a threat to the livelihood of local fishermen. The sudden influx of these creatures has raised concerns among the residents, as they can be dangerous and disrupt fishing activities. The reason for the sudden surge of blue jellyfish in the area remains unclear, but experts believe it could be due to changes in water temperature or pollution. The local government is working on finding solutions to mitigate the impact of these jellyfish on the community. Efforts are being made to educate the public on how to deal with these creatures and protect their livelihoods. The presence of these blue jellyfish highlights the need for sustainable practices in fishing and environmental conservation to ensure the continued prosperity of the local community.

Summary: The sudden influx of blue jellyfish, known as "bungkakol," in Butuan City, Agusan del Norte has posed a threat to the livelihood of local fishermen. The cause for their surge remains unclear, but experts suggest it could be due to changes in water temperature or pollution. The local government is working on finding solutions to mitigate the impact of these jellyfish on the community and promote sustainable practices in fishing and environmental conservation.

Maganda man pagmasdan ang pagdagsa ng kakaibang mga blue jellyfish o "bungkatol" sa baybayin ng Butuan City, Agusan del Norte, pero may dala naman itong peligro at perhuwisyo sa kabuhayan ng mga residenteng mangingisda. Bakit nga kaya dumagsa ang mga dikyang ito?

item.title: DBM OKs creation of over 4,000 jobs in 4Ps program
item.content:encoded: The Department of Budget and Management (DBM) has approved the creation of over 4,000 positions to support the implementation of the Pantawid Pamilyang Pilipino Program (4Ps).

item.title: Trillanes files cyberlibel complaint vs. Roque, SMNI, others
item.content:encoded: Former Senator Antonio "Sonny" Trillanes IV on Tuesday filed cyberlibel complaints against former presidential spokesperson Harry Roque, Sonshine Media Network International (SMNI), and others over their remarks against him.

item.title: Senators hit ERC over 'poor maintenance" of power plants
item.content:encoded: Several lawmakers on Tuesday questioned the Energy Regulatory Commission"s (ERC) lack of regular inspection of power plants that might have contributed to why there are outages being experienced in some areas.

item.title: CAAP-Davao keeping an eye on Quiboloy chopper
item.content:encoded: The private chopper of Kingdom of Jesus Christ founder Pastor Apollo Quiboloy was spotted flying over Davao City five times from May 1 to 14, 2024, the Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP)-Davao said.

item.title: Kidnapped Indonesian national escapes in Cavite
item.content:encoded: An Indonesian national kidnapped on May 4 was able to escape his captors in Cavite, according to the Police Regional Office 4A on Tuesday.

item.title: Senior citizen na tumatawid, patay nang masalpok ng motorsiklong 2 menor de edad ang sakay
item.content:encoded: Nasawi ang isang 86-anyos na lalaki na tumatawid nang masalpok siya ng isang motorsiklong may sakay na dalawang menor de edad sa Tondo, Maynila. Ang biktima, pauwi na matapos magsimba.

item.title: PH Navy warship deployed to Escoda Shoal amid alleged reclamation by China
item.content:encoded: The Philippine Navy on Tuesday said it has deployed a warship to Escoda Shoal (Sabina Shoal) amid the reported attempt of China to conduct reclamation activities in the area.

item.title: GSIS earmarks P1.7B for emergency loans of members in 13 areas affected by El Niño, rabies
item.content:encoded: The Government Service Insurance System (GSIS) said Tuesday it has allocated P1.7 billion in emergency loans to provide assistance to its members and pensioners affected by rabies and El Niño in 13 areas nationwide.

item.title: Manila records 'unhealthy' air index in 2 locations
item.content:encoded: The Manila Department of Public Services on Tuesday said that two areas in the city were noted to have an “unhealthy” air quality index (AQI).

item.title: LTO says no need to terminate contract with IT provider Dermalog
item.content:encoded: The Land Transportation Office (LTO) has maintained that it will not terminate its land transportation management system (LTMS) contract with Dermalog, the agency"s current information technology service provider, LTO chief Assistant Secretary Vigor Mendoza said Tuesday.

item.title: DSWD releases P64.8M-aid to El Niño-affected families in Western Visayas
item.content:encoded: The Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) has provided more than P64.8 million worth of assistance to families affected by the El Niño weather phenomenon in Western Visayas.

item.title: BI willing to submit Bamban Mayor Guo's travel records for investigation
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Immigration (BI) will submit the travel records of Bamban Mayor Alice Guo if they are subpoenaed, BI spokesperson Dana Sandoval said Tuesday.

item.title: RTL amendments not meant to restore NFA powers -DA
item.content:encoded:
Agriculture Secretary, powers, National Food Authority, stripped, RTL Summary: The Agriculture Secretary clarified that there are no plans to restore the powers of the National Food Authority that were removed after the enactment of the RTL. This decision indicates an intention to maintain the current system without reverting to previous arrangements. The Agriculture Secretary's statement assures stakeholders that there will be no revival of the NFA's powers, signaling a commitment to the current regulatory framework. This move may have implications for the food industry and relevant stakeholders who will operate under the existing guidelines. By confirming this stance, the Agriculture Secretary aims to provide clarity and stability in the sector, emphasizing a consistent approach to food regulation. Overall, the affirmation of no plans to revive the NFA's powers underscores a focus on the current regulatory landscape without reverting to past structures.

The Agriculture Secretary said there was no intention to revive the powers of the National Food Authority which were stripped from the NFA after the enactment of the RTL.

item.title: Marcos OKs gov't e-marketplace procurement system
item.content:encoded:
e-marketplace, procurement system, Department of Budget and Management, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., approval Summary: President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. approved the e-marketplace procurement system of the Department of Budget and Management. This system aims to streamline and modernize the procurement process, making it more efficient and transparent. The e-marketplace platform will allow for faster transactions and increased accountability in government procurement. President Marcos Jr.'s approval signifies a commitment to improving government procurement practices and embracing digital solutions to enhance service delivery. The Department of Budget and Management's e-marketplace system is expected to bring significant benefits in terms of cost savings and improved procurement outcomes.

President Ferdinand ''Bongbong'' Marcos Jr. on Tuesday approved the e-marketplace procurement system of the Department of Budget and Management.

item.title: 167 Tsino na nadakip sa ni-raid na POGO hub sa Bamban, Tarlac, ipina-deport sa China
item.content:encoded:
deportation, China, arrested, POGO hub, Bamban Tarlac Summary: Authorities in the Philippines deported 167 Chinese nationals back to China after they were arrested during a raid on a POGO hub in Bamban, Tarlac, in March. The individuals were part of an illegal online gambling operation and were taken into custody during the raid. Following their arrest, they were deported back to China, their home country. The raid was part of a crackdown on illegal online gambling activities in the Philippines, particularly targeting Chinese-run POGO hubs. This move is seen as a step towards curbing illegal gambling operations in the country and sending a message to those involved in such activities. The Chinese nationals were sent back to China in coordination with Chinese authorities, ensuring their safe return to their home country. This deportation serves as a warning to those engaged in illegal online gambling activities and highlights the government's commitment to enforcing laws and regulations in the country.

Ipina-deport pabalik sa China ang 167 mga Tsino na arestado sa isinagawang pagsalakay ng mga awtoridad sa isang POGO hub sa Bamban, Tarlac noong Marso.

item.title: Governments urged to act 'decisively' vs e-cigarettes
item.content:encoded: Over 70 government officials, youth representatives, and public health advocates from ASEAN countries gathered here on Tuesday for a two-day event to discuss concrete actions to protect children from tobacco industry interference.

item.title: Parts of Manila, Quezon City to experience power interruptions on May 15, 16
item.content:encoded: Parts of Manila and Quezon City are set to experience power service interruptions on May 15 and 16 due to scheduled maintenance activities.

item.title: Think tank backs revision of IP Code to fight online piracy
item.content:encoded: Think tank Stratbase ADR Institute has expressed support to the review and amendment of the Intellectual Property Code to combat the increasing incidents of online piracy in the country.

item.title: Carpio urges new case vs China over Escoda Shoal, Rozul Reef destruction
item.content:encoded: Retired Supreme Court Associate Justice Antonio Carpio on Tuesday urged the government to sue China anew, this time for damages due to the destruction of Escoda Shoal and Rozul Reef.

item.title: LTO chief assures zero backlog on license cards, plates by July
item.content:encoded: Land Transportation Office (LTO) chief Atty. Vigor Mendoza on Tuesday assured that there would be no more backlogs in releasing driver's license cards and plates starting this July.

item.title: Ombudsman lifts suspension of 72 more NFA personnel
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Office of the Ombudsman, preventive suspension, National Food Authority, rice buffer stocks, favored traders Summary: The Office of the Ombudsman has lifted the six-month preventive suspension imposed on 72 National Food Authority (NFA) personnel allegedly involved in irregular rice buffer stocks sale to favored traders. The suspension was connected to the reported misconduct of these employees. The decision to lift the suspension implies that the Ombudsman may have found insufficient evidence or other mitigating factors to justify their continued suspension. The investigation into this case likely revealed information that led to the suspension being lifted. This development could indicate that the Ombudsman did not find enough evidence to support the initial allegations. It suggests that the Ombudsman has determined the 72 personnel are no longer a risk or threat related to the irregular sale of rice buffer stocks.

The Office of the Ombudsman has lifted the supposed six-month preventive suspension imposed against 72 personnel of the National Food Authority (NFA) linked to the alleged irregular sale of rice buffer stocks to favored traders, Super Radyo dzBB"s Allan Gatus reported Tuesday.

item.title: Marcos says tourist arrivals show PH tourism recovery
item.content:encoded:
Tourist arrivals, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., recovery, tourism industry, country Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has remarked on the successful recovery of the tourism industry in the country based on the increasing number of tourist arrivals. The President's statement reflects an optimistic outlook on the industry's growth and vitality. The rise in tourist arrivals indicates a positive trend in the tourism sector, potentially boosting the country's economy and bringing in valuable revenue. The government's efforts to promote and sustain tourism have yielded positive results, attracting both local and international tourists to visit the country's various destinations. President Marcos Jr.'s acknowledgment of the industry's recovery signifies a promising future for tourism in the nation.

President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has said the tourist arrivals in the country have proven the tourism industry's recovery.

item.title: At least 14 killed after billboard collapses in Mumbai during thunderstorm
item.content:encoded:
billboard, India, Mumbai, thunderstorm, casualties
At least 14 people were killed and many others were injured in Mumbai, India when a massive billboard collapsed on them during a thunderstorm. The tragic incident occurred in the financial capital of the country, leaving dozens of people in critical condition. Local authorities have confirmed the number of casualties and are working to provide assistance to the victims and their families. The falling billboard caused chaos and devastation in the crowded area, highlighting the dangers posed by inclement weather conditions in urban areas. The incident serves as a stark reminder of the importance of ensuring public safety measures are in place to prevent such accidents from occurring in the future.

Summary:

At least 14 people have died and dozens were injured after a huge billboard fell on them during a thunderstorm in India's financial capital Mumbai, according to local authorities.

item.title: Drivers press for TRO vs PUVMP as arrest of 'colorum' PUVs looms
item.content:encoded: Two days before the government starts apprehending “colorum” PUVs, jeepney drivers and operators on Tuesday once again protested against the PUV Modernization Program.

item.title: Ex-senator Bam Aquino leaves LP
item.content:encoded: Former senator Paolo Benigno "Bam" Aquino IV has left the Liberal Party (LP) to lead a young political party, the Katipunan ng Nagkakaisang Pilipino (KANP).

item.title: Marcos declares July as agriculturists' month
item.content:encoded: President Marcos has declared July of every year as Philippine Agriculturists' Month with the aim to honor agriculturists and raise awareness on the importance of the agricultural sector in the country.

item.title: Gov't employees to receive midyear bonus starting May 15 --DBM
item.content:encoded:
government personnel, midyear bonus, May 15, Department of Budget and Management
Summary:
Qualified government personnel will start receiving their midyear bonus on May 15, as announced by the Department of Budget and Management. The bonus is set to be disbursed to eligible government employees starting mid-May. This initiative aims to provide additional financial support to government workers during the middle of the year. The Department of Budget and Management confirmed the distribution date for the midyear bonus, ensuring that qualified personnel will receive this benefit in a timely manner. This announcement is a positive development for government employees who will be able to benefit from the midyear bonus.

Qualified government personnel will receive their midyear bonus starting May 15 this year, the Department of Budget and Management said Tuesday.

item.title: Exclusion of CHR in Marcos' human rights body questioned
item.content:encoded:
Human Rights Watch, Commission of Human Rights, special human rights committee, President Marcos Jr., non-inclusion

The Human Rights Watch is raising concerns over President Marcos Jr.'s decision to exclude the Commission of Human Rights from a new special human rights committee. The committee, created by Marcos Jr., has been criticized for not including the independent human rights body, which is responsible for monitoring and investigating human rights violations in the country. This move has raised questions about the government's commitment to upholding human rights and protecting marginalized communities. The Human Rights Watch has called for the inclusion of the Commission of Human Rights in the committee to ensure transparency, accountability, and impartiality in addressing human rights issues. The exclusion of the commission raises concerns about the effectiveness and credibility of the newly formed committee in addressing human rights violations in the Philippines.

Summary: The Human Rights Watch is questioning the non-inclusion of the Commission of Human Rights in the new special human rights committee created by President Marcos Jr., raising concerns about the government's commitment to upholding human rights and protecting marginalized communities. The inclusion of the Commission of Human Rights is essential to ensure transparency, accountability, and impartiality in addressing human rights issues and to maintain the effectiveness and credibility of the committee in addressing human rights violations in the Philippines.

The Human Rights Watch is questioning the non-inclusion of the Commission of Human Rights in the new special human rights committee that President Marcos Jr. has created.

item.title: Landslide displaces over 200 families in Surigao del Norte
item.content:encoded:
families, displaced, landslide, Mainit, Surigao del Norte
Over 200 families, totaling more than 900 individuals, were displaced in Mainit, Surigao del Norte, when a devastating landslide struck the barangay. The natural disaster caused widespread destruction and forced the community to evacuate immediately. The landslide's impact was severe, leaving families homeless and in urgent need of assistance. Local authorities and disaster response teams were quickly mobilized to provide aid and support to those affected by the tragedy. The displaced families faced an uncertain future as they coped with the loss of their homes and belongings. The landslide served as a stark reminder of the vulnerability of communities to natural disasters and the importance of preparedness and response measures. Efforts were underway to assess the extent of the damage and implement long-term solutions to prevent similar incidents in the future.

Summary: - Over 200 families displaced - More than 900 individuals affected - Landslide hits barangay in Mainit - Severe destruction and urgent evacuation - Local authorities provide aid and support, emphasizing preparedness.

Over 200 families or more than 900 individuals were displaced when a landslide hit a barangay in Mainit, Surigao del Norte.

item.title: 2 sundalo, patay matapos tamaan ng kidlat sa Kalinga
item.content:encoded:
soldiers, killed, lightning, Lubuagan, Kalinga Summary: - Two soldiers were killed in Lubuagan, Kalinga, after being struck by lightning. - The incident was reported by Unang Balita on Tuesday. - The lightning strike resulted in the tragic deaths of the two soldiers. - The exact circumstances of the incident and the identities of the deceased soldiers were not provided in the initial report. - The community of Lubuagan is likely in shock and mourning following this tragic event.

Summary:

Dalawang sundalo ang patay matapos tamaan ng kidlat sa Lubuagan, Kalinga, ayon sa ulat ng Unang Balita nitong Martes.

item.title: 7,749 pass Philippine nurses licensure examination
item.content:encoded:
St. Jude College-Dasmariñas, Cavite, graduate, highest score, Philippine nurses licensure examination, earlier this month Summary: A graduate from St. Jude College-Dasmariñas, Cavite, achieved the highest score in the recent Philippine nurses licensure examination. Their outstanding performance reflects the quality education and training provided by the college. This achievement not only showcases the individual's dedication and hard work but also demonstrates the institution's commitment to excellence in nursing education. The high score attained by the graduate is a testament to their knowledge, skills, and competence in the field of nursing. It also highlights the rigorous preparation and academic support offered by St. Jude College-Dasmariñas, Cavite, in preparing its students for professional licensure exams. This accomplishment serves as an inspiration to aspiring nurses and a source of pride for the college, solidifying its reputation as a leading institution in the healthcare industry.

A graduate of St. Jude College-Dasmariñas, Cavite achieved the highest score in the Philippine nurses licensure examination held earlier this month.

item.title: Babaeng nagdya-jogging, nasapul ng motorsiklong sumemplang sa Pangasinan
item.content:encoded:
motorcycle accident, jogging, injury, Mangaldan, Pangasinan Summary: A woman was injured while jogging on the side of the road after being hit by a motorcycle that crashed after colliding with another motorcycle in Mangaldan, Pangasinan. The incident occurred as the woman was running along the roadside. The collision resulted in the woman being struck by one of the motorcycles, causing injuries. The accident took place in the town of Mangaldan in the province of Pangasinan. The woman was immediately attended to by bystanders and emergency responders. Authorities are investigating the circumstances that led to the collision between the two motorcycles. The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of road safety for both motorists and pedestrians.

Sugatan ang isang babaeng nagdya-jogging sa gilid ng kalsada matapos siyang tamaan ng isang motorsiklo na sumemplang makaraang sumagi sa isa ring motorsiklo sa Mangaldan, Pangasinan.

item.title: Israelis block aid convoy headed to Gaza, throw supplies to the ground
item.content:encoded:
protesters, aid trucks, Gaza, Israel, humanitarian supplies Summary: Israeli protesters blocked aid trucks heading to Gaza, causing chaos by strewing food packages on the road. Despite this incident, Israel vowed to ensure uninterrupted delivery of humanitarian supplies to the region. The protesters' actions led to disruptions in the aid distribution process, causing concern about the welfare of those in need in Gaza. The incident highlighted the ongoing tensions surrounding the conflict in the region, as well as the challenges in providing aid to those affected by the crisis. Israel's commitment to allowing continuous humanitarian assistance in Gaza contrasts with the disruptive actions taken by the protesters, underscoring the complex dynamics at play in the area. The incident serves as a reminder of the importance of addressing humanitarian needs in conflict zones and the obstacles faced in delivering aid effectively during times of crisis.

Summary:

Israeli protesters blocked aid trucks headed for Gaza, strewing food packages on the road in the latest incident as Israel pledged to allow uninterrupted humanitarian supplies in.

item.title: Paglalayag ng Pinoy civilian vessels sa WPS, tuloy sa kabila ng ulat na may mga Chinese vessel na haharang
