item.content:encoded: Tuloy umano ang paglalayag ng civilian mission sa West Philippine Sea (WPS) sa kabila ng ulat na may malaking bilang ng mga Chinese vessel ang patungo sa Scarborough Shoal.

item.title: Nasa 3,000 kilo ng hinog na mga mangga sa Isabela, itinapon na lang dahil hindi na maibenta
item.content:encoded: Itinapon na lang ng isang magsasaka sa Isabela ang nasa 3,000 kilo ng ani niyang mangga matapos na mahinog nang ibiyahe sa Metro Manila at hindi na maibenta.

item.title: Bata na isinilang na bingi, muling nakadinig dahil sa gene therapy sa England
item.content:encoded: Isang bata na isinilang umano na bingi ang nagkaroon ng pandinig matapos isailalim sa gene therapy sa England.

item.title: Isabela farmer discards 3,000 kilos of mangoes
item.content:encoded: A farmer in San Mateo, Isabela was forced to throw away around 3,000 kilos of ripe mangoes due to a supply surplus, according to a report by EJ Gomez on Monday's Saksi.

item.title: Families of couple stabbed to death in Davao call for justice
item.content:encoded:
found dead, condominium, Davao City, suicide, justice Summary: The bereaved families of a couple found dead in a Davao City condominium are demanding justice as the initial theory of suicide is being questioned. The couple's loved ones refuse to believe the suicide theory and are calling for a deeper investigation into the mysterious circumstances surrounding their deaths. The tragic incident has left the families devastated and desperate for answers as they struggle to come to terms with the loss. They are urging authorities to conduct a thorough investigation to uncover the truth and bring justice to the deceased couple. The grief-stricken families are determined to seek closure and are hopeful that the truth will eventually come to light, providing some semblance of peace and justice for their departed loved ones.

Summary:

The bereaved families of a couple who were found dead at a condominium in Davao City are calling for justice after an initial theory pointed to suicide.

item.title: 4 dead, many feared trapped under fallen Mumbai billboard during rainstorm
item.content:encoded:
Dead, Injured, Trapped, Billboard, Mumbai Summary: At least four people have died and 61 others have been injured in Mumbai after a massive billboard collapsed during a rainstorm. More than 40 people are feared to be trapped under the debris. The incident occurred in India's financial capital, causing chaos and destruction. Rescue efforts are underway to save those who are still trapped. Heavy rainfall has been reported in the area, leading to hazardous conditions and heightened risks of accidents. The tragedy has left a trail of devastation and loss in the city. Authorities are working to provide assistance to the victims and ensure the safety of the public.


At least four people are dead, 61 injured and more than 40 feared trapped after a massive billboard fell during a rainstorm in India's financial capital of Mumbai on Monday, officials said.

item.title: Illegally operating hospital for POGO workers raided in Pasay
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Presidential Anti-Organized Crime Commission, raid, illegally operating hospital, Philippine Offshore Gaming Operators (POGOs), Pasay City
Summary:
The Presidential Anti-Organized Crime Commission (PAOCC) conducted a raid on an illegally operating hospital in Pasay City that was allegedly linked to Philippine Offshore Gaming Operators (POGOs). The hospital was suspected of being used for illegal activities and money laundering related to the POGO industry. The raid was carried out to crack down on organized crime activities connected to the POGO industry, which has been a source of controversy in the Philippines. The PAOCC seized documents and evidence during the raid, leading to several arrests and further investigation into the hospital's operations. The government's action demonstrates a strong stance against illegal activities and corruption in the country, particularly in relation to the POGO industry, which has faced scrutiny for its impact on society and compliance with regulations.

The Presidential Anti-Organized Crime Commission (PAOCC) conducted a raid against an illegally operating hospital allegedly linked to Philippine Offshore Gaming Operators (POGOs) in Pasay City.

item.title: Bato wants to subpoena ex-ES Ochoa to appear at alleged PDEA leaks hearing
item.content:encoded: The Senate Committee on Public Order and Dangerous Drugs warned a subpoena may be served against ex-Executive Secretary Pacquito Ochoa over his non-appearance at the PDEA leaks hearing

item.title: 'Kiping' mothers of Lucban receive free med exams from GMA Kapuso Foundation
item.content:encoded: Ahead of the Pahiyas Festival, “kiping” makers in Lucban, Quezon received free breast examinations, pap smears and Human papillomavirus (HPV) screenings from the GMA Kapuso Foundation.

item.title: Isang isla sa Bohol, hindi na inirerekomendang tirhan dahil nalulubog na sa dagat
item.content:encoded: Nasa 600 pamilya sa isang isla sa Tubigon, Bohol ang nanganganib na mawalan ng tirahan dahil nilalamon na ng dagat ang kanilang lugar. Nagsimula raw ang lahat noong 2013 nang yanigin ng malakas na lindol ang lalawigin.

item.title: King Charles hands military title to son William in rare joint appearance
item.content:encoded: King Charles handed over a senior military role to Prince William on Monday, the two marking a rare joint appearance as the king steps up his return to public duties after his cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Man dies in Mother's Day party altercation
item.content:encoded:
Manila, victim, Mother's Day, party, killed

Summary: A 44-year-old man in Manila was killed during a Mother's Day party while trying to break up a fight between his nephew and brother-in-law. The victim intervened in the fistfight but tragically lost his life in the process. The incident occurred amidst what was supposed to be a joyful celebration, turning it into a scene of tragedy and loss for the family. The exact cause of the fight that led to the fatal outcome is unknown, but it serves as a stark reminder of how quickly situations can escalate into violence. The victim's selfless act of trying to stop the altercation ultimately cost him his life, leaving his loved ones to mourn his untimely passing on what should have been a day of happiness and togetherness. The loss of the victim has left a deep impact on the family, highlighting the devastating consequences of conflict and the importance of avoiding violence in any situation.

A 44-year-old victim was killed during a Mother's Day party in Manila when he tried to intervene in a fistfight between his nephew and brother-in-law.

item.title: No winners of major lotto draws on Monday, May 13, 2024
item.content:encoded:
winners, lotto draws, Monday, May 13, 2024, big
Summary: No one emerged as the winner of any of the major lotto draws that took place on Monday, May 13, 2024. It was reported that none of the draws produced a jackpot winner, leaving players hopeful for the next opportunity to win big. The absence of winners in these draws was unexpected, as many participants eagerly anticipate the results and the possibility of claiming a significant prize. Despite the lack of successful entries, players remain optimistic and continue to engage in future lotto events in the hopes of securing a coveted win. The outcome of these draws serves as a reminder of the unpredictable nature of lottery games and the element of chance that influences the results. The search for a lucky ticket holder continues as players eagerly await the next drawing in the hope of a jackpot triumph.

There were no winners of any of the big lotto draws held on Monday, May 13, 2024.

item.title: Teen in Cebu who killed 5-year old sibling to undergo psycho-social intervention
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: 14-year-old, teen, killed, half-brother, psycho-social intervention
Summary: A 14-year-old teen in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu, who allegedly killed his five-year-old half-brother will not face criminal charges. Instead, he will undergo psycho-social intervention to address any underlying issues that may have led to the tragic incident. The decision to not charge the teen was made after thorough consideration of his age and mental state. This approach emphasizes rehabilitation over punishment, aiming to provide the necessary support and intervention to prevent similar incidents in the future. The authorities recognize the importance of addressing the teen's psychological well-being and potential factors contributing to his actions. By focusing on psycho-social intervention, they aim to help the teen understand and cope with his emotions in a healthy and constructive manner. Placing importance on mental health support for young individuals involved in such incidents is crucial in promoting their overall well-being and preventing future harmful behaviors.

Summary:

The 14-year old teen who allegedly killed his five-year old half-brother in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu will not be charged with a crime but will instead undergo psycho-social intervention.

item.title: Chinese COVID-19 whistleblower due for release after 4 years in jail
item.content:encoded: Authorities in China were expected on Monday to release a citizen journalist jailed for four years after she documented the early phases of the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan in 2020.

item.title: Solons question embedding of TVET in senior high curriculum
item.content:encoded: Solons questioned the embedding of technical and vocational education and training in the senior high curriculum, a revision agreed on by three government agencies.

item.title: Suspek sa panggagahasa sa Grade 4 pupil sa Cotabato, patay nang manlaban umano sa mga pulis
item.content:encoded: Patay na at ginahasa pa ang 10-anyos na babaeng Grade 4 pupil nang matagpuan sa pinyahan sa Tupi, South Cotabato. Ang 44-anyos na suspek, napatay naman nang manlaban umano habang nasa presinto.

item.title: 2 teens nabbed in Biñan, Laguna for pimping minors online
item.content:encoded:
arrested, teenagers, suspected, pimping, entrapment Summary: Two teenagers were arrested in an entrapment operation in Biñan, Laguna on suspicion of pimping minors online. The operation targeted individuals who were exploiting minors through online platforms. The suspects were apprehended following an undercover operation conducted by authorities. The arrests were made as part of efforts to combat online exploitation of minors and human trafficking. The teenagers are facing charges related to pimping and could potentially be tried as adults due to the seriousness of the allegations.Authorities are cracking down on such criminal activities to protect vulnerable individuals and ensure that those responsible are held accountable for their actions.

Summary:

Two teenagers who were suspected of pimping minors online were arrested in an entrapment operation in Biñan, Laguna.

item.title: Israeli forces push into Gaza from north and south
item.content:encoded:
Israeli forces, Gaza, Hamas, tanks, troops
Israeli forces have advanced into Gaza's northern area and crossed into Rafah to recapture territories supposedly won from Hamas months ago. The incursion involved tanks and troops pushing into the ruins of Gaza's north, as well as crossing a highway into Rafah. This move signifies a significant military operation by Israeli forces in the ongoing conflict in Gaza. The operation appears to be aimed at regaining control of strategic territories that had previously been taken over by Hamas, demonstrating Israel's determination to maintain security and stability in the region. The incursion also highlights the ongoing tensions between Israel and Hamas, with both sides engaged in a protracted conflict with no clear end in sight. The push into Gaza's north and Rafah represents a bold and aggressive move by Israeli forces to assert their dominance over the region and keep Hamas at bay.

Summary: Israeli forces have advanced deep into the ruins of Gaza's north and crossed a highway into Rafah in a bid to recapture territories from Hamas. This military operation underscores Israel's determination to maintain security in the region and regain control of strategic areas previously held by Hamas. The incursion demonstrates the ongoing tensions between Israel and Hamas, with both sides engaged in a protracted conflict. The push into Gaza's north and Rafah reflects Israel's aggressive stance towards Hamas and the region.

Israeli forces pushed deep into the ruins of Gaza's north to recapture an area where they claimed to have defeated Hamas months ago, while tanks and troops pushed across a highway into Rafah.

item.title: Anak, ipina-tattoo ang nakasaad sa huling liham ng kaniyang pumanaw na ina
item.content:encoded:
wallet, anak, sulat, namayapang ina, tattoo Summary: The article discusses how a child kept a letter from their deceased mother in their wallet to cherish the memory. To ensure the letter would not get lost or damaged, the child decided to tattoo the contents of the letter onto their body. This act symbolized the deep connection and love the child had for their mother. The decision to permanently ink the words of the letter onto their skin showcased the lasting impact the mother had on the child's life. The story highlights the enduring bond between a parent and a child, even after death. It also emphasizes the importance of preserving cherished memories and honoring loved ones in unique and meaningful ways. The act of tattooing the letter's contents served as a tribute to the mother and a reminder of the love and guidance she provided.

Iniingatan at nakalagay sa wallet ng isang anak ang sulat ng iniwan sa kaniya ng kaniyang namayapang ina. Para hindi na ito mawala o masira, ang mga nakasaad sa sulat, ipina-tattoo niya sa kaniyang katawan.

item.title: Jinggoy, ex-PDEA agent Morales in heated exchange over 'PDEA leaks"
item.content:encoded:
Senate, Jinggoy Estrada, Jonathan Morales, heated exchange, leaked documents
Summary:
During a Senate probe, Senator Jinggoy Estrada and ex-PDEA officer Jonathan Morales engaged in a heated verbal exchange regarding leaked confidential documents implicating President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. in illegal drug activities. The confrontation took place on Monday and escalated tensions during the investigation. Estrada and Morales clashed over the authenticity and implications of the leaked information, with both parties vehemently defending their positions. The incident added a dramatic element to the proceedings and highlighted the intense scrutiny surrounding the alleged involvement of high-profile individuals in drug-related offenses. The conflict between the senator and the former intelligence officer underscored the contentious nature of the issue and the fierce debate surrounding the leaked documents. As the probe continued, the exchange between Estrada and Morales served as a dramatic moment in an already charged atmosphere, reflecting the complex and contentious nature of the investigation. Despite the heated confrontation, the Senate continued its investigation into the leaked documents and their implications for President Marcos Jr. and others involved in the controversy.
Summary:

Senator Jinggoy Estrada and ex-Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency intelligence officer Jonathan Morales on Monday had a heated verbal exchange during the Senate probe into the supposed leaked confidential documents linking President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to illegal drugs.

item.title: PNP checking alleged data breach in its logistics system
item.content:encoded:
keywords: Philippine National Police, breach, logistics, data, management system Summary: The Philippine National Police (PNP) is investigating a potential breach in its logistics, data, information, and management system. The PNP announced on Monday that they are looking into the security issue to determine the extent of the breach and assess the impact on their systems. It is crucial for law enforcement agencies to ensure the safety and integrity of their data and information, as any breach could pose a threat to national security. The PNP's investigation will focus on identifying any vulnerabilities in their system and implementing necessary measures to prevent future breaches. This incident highlights the importance of cybersecurity measures in protecting sensitive information and maintaining the efficiency of operations within the police force.

Summary:

The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Monday said it was looking into a possible breach in its logistics, data, information, and management system.

item.title: Comelec: Bamban Mayor Guo could face perjury if proven not a Filipino citizen
item.content:encoded:
charge, perjury, misdeclared, Filipino citizen, Comelec Summary: Mayor Alice Guo of Bamban could face perjury charges if she falsely claimed to be a Filipino citizen. The Commission on Elections (Comelec) Chairperson George Garcia stated that if she misdeclared her citizenship status, legal action could be taken against her. Guo may be held accountable for committing perjury if it is proven that she falsely identified herself as a Filipino citizen. Garcia emphasized that accurate citizenship declaration is crucial, especially for public officials like Guo. The Comelec is responsible for ensuring that candidates meet all qualifications, including citizenship, to hold public office. Guo's alleged misdeclaration could have serious legal consequences, as perjury is a punishable offense under Philippine law. It is essential for public officials to uphold honesty and integrity in their declarations to avoid facing legal repercussions.

Bamban Mayor Alice Guo could be charged with perjury if she misdeclared herself as a Filipino citizen, Commission on Elections (Comelec) chairperson George Garcia said on Monday.

item.title: 1 hurt after streetlight fell along Quezon Ave due to strong winds

item.title: 5-anyos na lalaki, nilunod ng kaniyang 14-anyos na half-brother sa Cebu

item.title: Gov't task force told to prepare for La Niña

item.title: 7 detainees bolt PDEA jail in Zamboanga
item.content:encoded: Seven detainees broke out of a facility of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) in Zamboanga City on Monday, according to the Philippine National Police (PNP).

item.title: PCG says it will block China reclamation at Escoda Shoal

item.title: Marcos to newly-promoted generals: Be a boot on the ground
item.content:encoded:
promoted, military officials, security challenges, soldiers, President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. urged newly-promoted military officials to actively engage with soldiers in addressing the security challenges in the country. He emphasized the importance of hands-on involvement and encouraged the officials to work closely with the troops on the ground. By fostering a collaborative approach, Marcos believes that the military can effectively tackle the various security issues currently facing the nation. The President's directive highlights the need for unity and cooperation within the armed forces to ensure the safety and stability of the country. By engaging directly with soldiers, the newly-promoted officials can gain a better understanding of the challenges they face and work together to find solutions. Marcos' message serves as a call to action for the military leadership to prioritize cooperation and teamwork in their efforts to safeguard the nation's security.

Summary:

President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. on Monday told newly-promoted military officials to work among the soldiers in addressing the security challenges facing the country.

item.title: PNP eyes transferring Maguindanao cop's murder case after suspects released
item.content:encoded:
murder, cop, Maguindanao, suspects, police
Summary:
The Philippine National Police (PNP) is transferring the case of a cop's murder in Maguindanao after two suspects, who are police officers, were released. The PNP is working on the transfer process to ensure a fair and impartial investigation. The suspects, who were initially detained, have been released pending further investigation. The case has raised concerns about the role of police officers in the killing of their fellow law enforcers. The PNP is committed to pursuing justice for the slain cop and will continue to cooperate with relevant authorities in the investigation.

The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Monday said it is working on transferring the case on the murder of a cop in Maguindanao after two suspects, who are police officers, have been released.

item.title: Lalaki, patay matapos pagsasaksakin ng live-in partner niyang babae
item.content:encoded:
Legazpi City, Albay, woman, man, stabbed Summary: A man in Legazpi City, Albay, was fatally stabbed by a woman, resulting in his death. The incident occurred between the woman and her male companion, leading to a violent altercation where she used a knife to attack him. The man sustained severe injuries from the stabbing and succumbed to his wounds shortly after the altercation. The motive behind the attack remains unclear, and authorities are conducting an investigation to determine the circumstances that led to the violent confrontation. The woman is currently facing charges related to the stabbing and could potentially be held accountable for the man's death. The tragic event has shocked the community in Legazpi City, highlighting the importance of addressing conflicts and disputes in a peaceful and constructive manner to prevent such senseless acts of violence.

Patay matapos pagsasaksakin ng isang babae ang kaniyang kinakasamang lalaki sa Legazpi City, Albay.

item.title: DFA to probe illegal activities of diplomats amid alleged China-PH 'new model' deal recording
item.content:encoded: The Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) on Monday said it will investigate the involvement of foreign diplomats in illegal activities and vowed to take the "necessary action."

item.title: Putin taps economist to run defense, replacing Shoigu in unexpected move
item.content:encoded: Russian President Vladimir Putin tapped a civilian economist as his surprise new defense minister on Sunday in an attempt to gird Russia for economic war by trying to better utilize the defense budget and harness greater innovation to win in Ukraine.

item.title: Parts of Caloocan, Navotas to experience power service interruption
item.content:encoded: Parts of Caloocan and Navotas are set to experience power service interruption on Tuesday and Wednesday due to a line reconstruction along C-3 Road.
