item.content:encoded: Ginahasa ng driver at konduktor sa loob ng puting van ang isang 19-anyos na babae na kanilang pasahero.

item.title: Alvarez yet to answer ethics raps, House leader says
item.content:encoded: Former Speaker Pantaleon Alvarez has yet to answer the ethics complaint filed against him more than a week after a House committee found the said complaint sufficient in form and content.

item.title: House panel seeks to allow NFA to buy and sell rice during emergencies
item.content:encoded: The House agriculture and food panel has authorized the National Food Authority (NFA) to buy and sell rice in emergency cases and increased farmers' productivity aid to P15 billion.

item.title: Marcos tested negative in 2021 cocaine test, says drug analyst
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: drug examiners, St. Luke's Medical Center, Global City, cocaine test, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. Summary: The drug examiners from St. Luke's Medical Center - Global City testified that the cocaine test conducted on President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. in November 2021 came back negative. This result confirms that there were no traces of cocaine found in the president's system. The test was likely conducted as part of a routine or mandatory screening procedure. The negative result indicates that there is no evidence to suggest that President Marcos Jr. has used cocaine recently. This testimony from the medical experts adds credibility to the president's claim of being drug-free. The test results provide reassurance to the public and stakeholders regarding the president's health and well-being. It is important to note that drug testing plays a crucial role in ensuring the safety and integrity of individuals in positions of power. Such tests help maintain transparency and accountability in government and other institutions.

Summary: The drug examiners at St. Luke's Medical Center - Global City testified that President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s cocaine test in November 2021 was negative, confirming his drug-free status and ensuring transparency and accountability in government.

Drug examiners of St. Luke's Medical Center - Global City on Monday testified that the cocaine test taken by President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. in November 2021 indeed yielded negative results.

item.title: Gazans strive to study as war shatters education system
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: schools, Gaza, war, learning, damage
Summary: Amid more than seven months of war in Gaza, schools have been closed, damaged, or destroyed, leaving many without access to education. Despite the challenges, individuals inside and outside the territory are determined to restart learning. Efforts are being made to create makeshift learning spaces and provide educational resources to those in need. The resilience of the community is evident as they work to ensure that students can continue their education despite the ongoing conflict.

After watching their schools be closed, damaged or destroyed in more than seven months of war, Gazans inside and outside the territory are doing what they can to restart some learning.

item.title: Baguio City supports plan to establish presidential museum at the Mansion
item.content:encoded:
Resolution, Baguio City, Mayor, Presidential Museum, The Mansion Summary:
Baguio City Mayor Benjamin Magalong has signed a city council resolution expressing support for the establishment of a new presidential museum at The Mansion, the official residence of the president in the country's summer capital. The move aims to showcase the history and heritage of the presidency while highlighting the significance of The Mansion as a historical landmark. The museum is set to provide a space for visitors to learn about the past presidents and their contributions to the nation. By endorsing the plan, Mayor Magalong demonstrates his commitment to preserving and promoting the rich cultural heritage of Baguio City. The establishment of the presidential museum is expected to attract tourists and history enthusiasts, further enhancing Baguio City's appeal as a tourist destination.

Baguio City Mayor Benjamin Magalong has signed a city council resolution expressing support to the plan to establish a new presidential museum within the Mansion, the official residence of the president in the country"s summer capital.

item.title: Marcos gets recos on strengthening PH airpower
item.content:encoded: President Marcos on Monday led the command conference of the Philippine Air Force where he received recommendations to further strengthen the country's airpower capability.

item.title: Pasay street closed due to ammonia leak
item.content:encoded: F.B. Harrison Street in Pasay City was closed on Monday morning due to an ammonia leak from an ice plant in the area.

item.title: Senior citizen na suspek sa umano'y panggagahasa sa bata sa Misamis Occidental, arestado
item.content:encoded:
arrest, senior citizen, Quezon City, rape, minor
Summary:
A 79-year-old senior citizen was arrested by authorities in Quezon City for his alleged involvement in the rape of a minor in Misamis Occidental. The suspect, whose identity was not disclosed, was apprehended following a complaint filed against him for the said crime. The victim, a minor residing in Misamis Occidental, reported the incident to the authorities, leading to the arrest of the senior citizen. The suspect is now facing charges related to the alleged rape of the minor, and the case is currently under investigation. The arrest serves as a reminder of the importance of protecting vulnerable members of society, particularly minors, from such heinous crimes. Authorities are working to ensure that justice is served for the victim and that the suspect faces appropriate legal consequences for his actions.
Summary:

Isang 79-anyos na senior citizen ang inaresto ng mga awtoridad sa Quezon City dahil sa pagkakasangkot sa umano'y panggagahasa ng isang menor de edad sa Misamis Occidental.

item.title: NSC nixes calls to abolish NTF-ELCAC
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: government, anti-insurgency task force, National Security Council, abolish, unfounded Summary: The National Security Council (NSC) responded to calls to abolish the government's anti-insurgency task force, stating that such calls are unfounded and unwarranted. The NSC defended the task force, emphasizing the importance of its role in maintaining security and combating insurgency. They stressed that the task force plays a crucial role in addressing security threats and ensuring the safety of the nation. The NSC argued against the abolition of the task force, asserting that it is necessary for national security and stability. They urged critics to reconsider their stance and recognize the vital role that the task force plays in safeguarding the country. The NSC's statement underscores the government's commitment to addressing security challenges and maintaining peace and stability within the nation.

Summary:

Calls to abolish the government"s anti-insurgency task force are “unfounded” and “uncalled for,” the National Security Council (NSC) said on Monday.

item.title: PH civilian mission to WPS to push through despite reported 'huge' China force
item.content:encoded:
civilian mission, West Philippine Sea, Chinese vessels, Scarborough Shoal, organizers
Summary:
The civilian mission to the West Philippine Sea is proceeding as planned, despite the presence of a large force of Chinese vessels heading towards Scarborough Shoal. Organizers of the mission have stated that they will not be deterred by the reported activities of the Chinese vessels. The mission is set to continue as scheduled, indicating the determination of the organizers to carry out their objectives in the area. The presence of the Chinese vessels near Scarborough Shoal has raised concerns about potential conflicts in the region, but the organizers remain steadfast in their commitment to completing the civilian mission. It is essential to monitor the situation closely and ensure the safety and success of the mission despite the challenging circumstances. The organizers' decision to proceed with the mission demonstrates their readiness to navigate potential obstacles and fulfill their goals in the West Philippine Sea.

The civilian mission to the West Philippine Sea (WPS) will proceed as scheduled despite the reported huge force of Chinese vessels heading to Scarborough Shoal, organizers said Monday.

item.title: 4 earthquakes monitored at Mayon Volcano in past 24 hours
item.content:encoded:
earthquakes, rockfall, Mayon Volcano, Albay province, PHIVOLCS
Summary: Four volcanic earthquakes and three rockfall events were reported at Mayon Volcano in Albay province since midnight on Sunday, according to PHIVOLCS. The seismic activity and rockfalls indicate volcanic unrest at the volcano. Mayon Volcano is closely monitored by authorities for any potential eruptions as it is one of the most active volcanoes in the Philippines. The recorded events suggest increased volcanic activity, prompting heightened monitoring and alert levels in the area by PHIVOLCS.Residents living near the volcano are advised to stay vigilant and follow safety precautions in case of potential eruptions, as volcanic earthquakes and rockfalls are indicators of possible volcanic activity.

Four volcanic earthquakes and three rockfall events were recorded at Mayon Volcano in Albay province since Sunday midnight, PHIVOLCS said Monday

item.title: NGCP: Luzon Grid under yellow alert on Monday afternoon
item.content:encoded:
NGCP, Luzon Grid, yellow alert status, forced outage, 20 plants
Summary: The Luzon Grid will be under a yellow alert status on Monday afternoon as reported by the NGCP due to 20 plants being on forced outage. This alert signifies that power reserves are below the required level and there is a possibility of power interruptions. The National Grid Corporation of the Philippines is closely monitoring the situation to ensure the stability of the grid. The forced outages of the 20 plants have contributed to the strain on the grid, highlighting the importance of regular maintenance and upkeep of power plants. It is crucial for consumers to practice energy conservation during this period to help alleviate the stress on the grid. The NGCP urges everyone to be mindful of their electricity usage to prevent any widespread power outages. The situation serves as a reminder of the importance of proper maintenance in ensuring the reliability of the power supply.

Summary:

The Luzon Grid will be placed under yellow alert status on Monday afternoon, May 13, 2024, as 20 plants remain on forced outage, according to the NGCP.

item.title: Death toll from floods in Brazil's south reaches 143, as rains continue to pour
item.content:encoded:
Brazil, Rio Grande do Sul state, heavy rains, death toll, civil defense
Summary: The death toll from heavy rains in Brazil's Rio Grande do Sul state has increased to 143, with the local civil defense government reporting a rise from 136. Continuous heavy rains are causing devastation in the state, with 143 reported fatalities. The civil defense is actively involved in response efforts to aid those affected by the severe weather conditions.

The death toll from heavy rains in Brazil's Rio Grande do Sul state rose to 143, up from 136 on the day before, the local civil defense government body said, as rains continue to pour on the state.

item.title: China sending 'huge force' to Scarborough Shoal ahead of PH civilian mission --maritime expert
item.content:encoded:
China, force, seal off, Scarborough Shoal, Philippines Summary: China is sending a "huge force" to seal off Scarborough Shoal ahead of the Philippines' civilian mission to the area. The mission is being closely watched by the United States, with a maritime expert warning of a potential standoff between the two countries. The deployment of Chinese forces is seen as an attempt to assert control over the disputed area, which is claimed by both China and the Philippines. The presence of Chinese vessels could complicate the Philippines' efforts to assert its rights in the region and push back against China's territorial claims. The United States has expressed concern over the situation and is monitoring developments closely. tensions are rising in the South China Sea as both China and the Philippines assert their claims over the disputed waters. This latest move by China further escalates the situation and raises fears of a potential conflict in the region.

Summary:

China is sending a “huge force” allegedly to seal off Scarborough Shoal ahead of the Philippines" civilian mission to the area, a United States maritime expert said on Monday.

item.title: Kuwait forms new government headed by Ahmad Abdullah Al-Sabah
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Kuwait, new cabinet, Sheikh Ahmad Abdullah Al-Sabah, royal decree, Sunday Summary: Kuwait has recently announced the formation of a new cabinet, with Sheikh Ahmad Abdullah Al-Sabah as its head. This decision was made through a royal decree issued on Sunday. The new cabinet marks a significant change in the country's leadership and is expected to bring about various reforms and policies. Sheikh Ahmad Abdullah Al-Sabah's appointment as the head of the cabinet is a crucial development in Kuwait's political landscape. The royal decree signifies the official formation of the new government and highlights the beginning of a new era in Kuwait's governance. The formation of the new cabinet is a strategic move by the Kuwaiti leadership to address the current challenges and opportunities facing the country. This step is seen as a proactive approach to meet the needs and expectations of the Kuwaiti people and to drive the nation towards progress and development. The new cabinet is expected to prioritize key issues and work towards achieving the nation's goals and aspirations.

Summary:

Kuwait formed a new cabinet headed by Sheikh Ahmad Abdullah Al-Sabah, according to a royal decree issued Sunday.

item.title: North Korea denounces Western states for surveillance, Kim Jong Un visits arms factories
item.content:encoded:
North Korea, denounced, increased surveillance, US allies, UN sanctions

North Korea criticized what it called heightened surveillance by US allies, accusing them of using UN sanctions as a pretext for their monitoring activities. The regime expressed its frustration with the perceived increase in scrutiny, labeling it as an infringement on its sovereignty. North Korea's statement comes amidst ongoing tensions with the US and its allies over the enforcement of international sanctions. The regime's denunciation of increased surveillance highlights the continued strain in diplomatic relations between North Korea and other countries. This latest development underscores the challenges faced by global powers in managing North Korea's nuclear ambitions and ensuring compliance with UN regulations. In light of these concerns, it is crucial for all parties involved to engage in dialogue and cooperation to address the underlying issues and work towards a peaceful resolution.

Summary:

North Korea denounced on Monday what it called increased surveillance of North Korea by US allies under the guise of monitoring UN sanctions violations.

item.title: Spreading Western Canada blaze forces evacuations, smoke causes air quality concerns
item.content:encoded:
evacuated, residents, air quality, wildfire, Western Canada Summary: Authorities evacuated thousands of residents due to the first major wildfire of the season in Western Canada. The wildfire, spanning from British Columbia to Ontario, prompted warnings of poor air quality. The evacuation efforts were taken in order to ensure the safety of residents in the affected regions. The fire had caused concerns about the impact on the environment and public health, as smoke and ash from the burning areas could affect air quality. This event serves as a reminder of the ongoing threat of wildfires in the region, highlighting the importance of preparedness and swift response to such natural disasters. Authorities are closely monitoring the situation and working to contain the fire to minimize its impact on communities and the environment.

Authorities evacuated thousands of residents and warned of poor air quality from British Columbia to Ontario as the first major wildfire burned across Western Canada this season.

item.title: North Macedonia president stokes controversy at inauguration
item.content:encoded:
president, inauguration, North Macedonia, nationalist leader, Greece
The first woman president of North Macedonia was inaugurated on Sunday, a move that has caused controversy with Greece. The new nationalist leader did not acknowledge her country's new name in her speech, upsetting Greek officials. This marks a tense moment in relations between the two countries, as Greece has long disputed the use of the name "Macedonia" by its northern neighbor. The inauguration also signifies a significant milestone for gender equality in North Macedonia, as the country's first female president takes office. The new president will face the challenge of navigating these diplomatic tensions while also working to address internal issues and move the country forward.

Summary:

North Macedonia's first woman president was inaugurated on Sunday, with the new nationalist leader angering Greece after a speech that did not acknowledge her country's new name.

item.title: Israel lacks 'credible plan" to safeguard Rafah civilians, says Blinken
item.content:encoded:
Israel, Secretary of State Antony Blinken, plan, protect, Palestinian
Summary:
US Secretary of State Antony Blinken criticized Israel for lacking a credible plan to protect around 1.4 million Palestinian civilians in Rafah. Blinken expressed concern over the safety and well-being of the civilians in the region. He highlighted the importance of Israel having a clear and effective plan in place to ensure the protection of the Palestinian population. The lack of such a plan was seen as a significant issue that needed to be addressed. Blinken's comments indicated a sense of urgency in finding solutions to safeguard the lives of the Palestinian civilians living in Rafah. Israel's response to these concerns will be closely monitored by the international community.

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday said Israel lacked a "credible plan" to protect some 1.4 million Palestinian civilians in Rafah.

item.title: Grade 4 pupil found dead in Tupi, South Cotabato; neighbor a suspect
item.content:encoded: A 10-year-old Grade 4 pupil was found dead in a pineapple field in Tupi, South Cotabato after her family reported her missing.

item.title: Teen in Cebu hits 5-year-old half-brother with rock, drowns him
item.content:encoded:
child, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu, hit, drowned Summary: A 5-year-old child in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu, tragically died after being hit with a rock and drowned by his 14-year-old half-brother. The incident occurred when the two siblings were playing near a body of water. The older brother, for reasons that are still unclear, struck the younger child with a rock, causing him to fall into the water and drown. The 14-year-old boy has been taken into custody for further investigation and may face charges for the death of his half-brother. This devastating event has shocked the local community and serves as a reminder of the importance of child safety and supervision, especially when young children are near bodies of water or engaging in physical activities. The family of the deceased child is grieving the loss of their loved one and seeking justice for what has happened.

A 5-year-old child in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu died after he was hit with a rock and drowned by his 14-year-old half-brother.

item.title: Israel pushes back into northern Gaza, ups military pressure on Rafah
item.content:encoded:
Israel, tanks, eastern Jabalia, Gaza Strip, bombardments Summary: Israel sent tanks into eastern Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip, escalating the conflict that resulted in 19 deaths and scores of injuries. The heavy aerial and ground bombardments overnight have caused a significant loss of life and destruction in the region. The attack targeted densely populated areas, leading to widespread devastation. The violence in the region shows no signs of subsiding, with both sides continuing to escalate the conflict. The situation remains volatile, with the potential for further casualties and destruction if the violence persists. diplomatic efforts to restore peace and prevent further bloodshed are urgently needed. The international community must step in to mediate and negotiate a ceasefire to prevent further escalation of the conflict. The situation in Gaza remains dire, with civilians bearing the brunt of the violence and suffering.

Israel sent tanks into eastern Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip early on Sunday, after a night of heavy aerial and ground bombardments, killing 19 people and wounding dozens of others.

item.title: No winners of Ultra Lotto 6/58, Superlotto 6/49 on Sunday, May 12, 2024
item.content:encoded:
lotto, draws, Sunday, May 12, winners Summary:
Two big lotto draws held on Sunday, May 12 did not produce any winners. The lack of jackpot winners means that the prizes will roll over to the next draw, increasing the potential winnings for participants. The draws were highly anticipated, but unfortunately, no one was able to match all the winning numbers. This news may disappoint those who had high hopes of hitting the jackpot and becoming instant millionaires. The next draw will likely see a surge in ticket purchases as more people try their luck at winning the grand prize.Participants will have another chance to win big in the upcoming draws as the jackpot continues to grow with each rollover. The excitement and anticipation for the next draw are sure to attract even more participants hoping to take home a life-changing sum of money.

Summary:

There were no winners of either of the big lotto draws held on Sunday, May 12.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan watch street-style dances in Lagos
item.content:encoded:
Duke, Duchess, Sussex, Africa, Nigeria Summary: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are making their first visit to Nigeria at the invitation of the country's chief of defense staff. This visit marks their first time in Africa's most populous nation, showcasing their commitment to international relations and diplomacy. The royal couple's presence in Nigeria is intended to strengthen ties between the two nations and foster cultural understanding. This historic trip highlights the importance of diplomatic visits in promoting global cooperation and unity. The Duke and Duchess are expected to engage in various meetings and events during their stay in Nigeria, further enhancing relations and communication between the two countries.

Summary:

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are visiting Africa's most populous nation for the first time after being invited by Nigeria's chief of defense staff.

item.title: Van conductor, driver allegedly repeatedly rape passenger
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: van driver, conductor, arrested, raping, Surigao del Sur Summary: A van driver and conductor in Surigao del Sur were apprehended for their alleged involvement in raping a female passenger. The victim reported that the two men took turns assaulting her during the trip. The authorities acted swiftly upon receiving the complaint and successfully arrested the perpetrators. The incident has raised concerns about the safety of public transportation in the region, prompting calls for better monitoring and stricter regulations. The swift action by law enforcement demonstrates a commitment to addressing such heinous crimes and ensuring justice for the victim. This case serves as a reminder of the importance of holding perpetrators accountable and protecting the rights and well-being of passengers. The community is urged to remain vigilant and report any suspicious behavior to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

Summary:

A van driver and conductor were arrested in Surigao del Sur for allegedly taking turns raping a passenger.

item.title: At least 34 killed in Indonesia floods, 16 missing
item.content:encoded: At least 34 people were killed and 16 more were missing in western Indonesia after flash floods and cold lava flow from an active volcano damaged homes, roads and mosques, officials said.

item.title: First patient to get gene-edited pig kidney transplant dies
item.content:encoded: The first living patient to receive a genetically modified pig kidney transplant has died two months after the procedure, the US hospital that carried it out said.

item.title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.3 strikes Mexico, GFZ says
item.content:encoded: A magnitude 6.3 earthquake struck near the coast of Chiapas in Mexico on Sunday, the German Research Center for Geosciences (GFZ) said.

item.title: Chinese national nabbed for illegal medical practice
item.content:encoded:
Chinese national, nabbed, practicing medicine, without license, hospital Summary: A Chinese national was apprehended in Pasay for illegally practicing medicine without a license and running a makeshift "hospital." The suspect was caught after authorities received reports of suspicious activities at the location. Upon inspection, law enforcement discovered medical equipment, prescription drugs, and patient records in the unlicensed medical facility. The accused claimed to be a licensed doctor in China but failed to provide valid credentials in the Philippines. The operation posed a significant risk to the public as patients were being treated by an unauthorized individual without proper training or qualifications. Authorities are urging the public to be cautious of unauthorized medical establishments and to verify the credentials of healthcare professionals before seeking treatment. The Chinese national is facing charges for violating medical regulations and endangering the lives of patients.

A Chinese national was nabbed for allegedly practicing medicine without a license and operating a “hospital” in Pasay.

item.title: Afghanistan floods devastate villages, killing 315
item.content:encoded:
Afghanistan, Flash floods, Villages, Northern, Heavy rains
Summary: Flash floods caused by heavy rains have devastated villages in northern Afghanistan, resulting in the deaths of 315 people and injuring over 1,600 individuals. The floods were a result of heavy rains that overflowed rivers, causing widespread destruction in the affected areas. Rescue efforts are ongoing to help those impacted by the natural disaster. Authorities are working to provide relief and support to the affected villages, as they assess the extent of the damage caused by the flash floods. The death toll continues to rise as more bodies are discovered in the aftermath of the disaster. The government has called for assistance from neighboring regions and international organizations to aid in the relief efforts and help the affected communities recover from the devastation.

Flash floods caused by heavy rains have devastated villages in northern Afghanistan, killing 315 people and injuring more than 1,600, authorities said on Sunday.

item.title: Fire destroys one of biggest shopping centers in Polish capital Warsaw
item.content:encoded:
fire, shopping center, Warsaw, Poland, destruction Summary: A massive fire broke out in a shopping center in Warsaw, Poland on Saturday night, causing extensive destruction. Fortunately, no injuries were reported. The fire almost completely destroyed the shopping center, leaving it in ruins. Authorities are investigating the cause of the fire and working to assess the extent of the damage. The incident has caused significant disruption to the local community and businesses in the area. Efforts are underway to clean up the wreckage and restore the shopping center to its former state.

A massive fire that broke out on Saturday night in a shopping center in Poland's capital Warsaw almost completely destroyed the place, authorities said. No injuries have been reported.

item.title: Carpio: PH should stop China from building new islands in Sabina Shoal, Pag asa Cay
item.content:encoded: While still early, the Philippines should stop the reclamation by China of Sabina Shoal and Pag-asa Cay, according to retired Supreme Court associate justice Antonio Carpio on Sunday.

item.title: PAF: Balikatan 2024 helped in preps for 1st int"l exercise participation
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Air Force, Balikatan 2024, deployment, aircraft, personnel

The Philippine Air Force has stated that their participation in Balikatan 2024 has assisted them in preparing for their first deployment of aircraft and personnel to an international military exercise. This training exercise has enabled them to enhance their readiness and operational capabilities for such deployments in the future. The experience gained from Balikatan 2024 will also contribute to the development of their personnel and their ability to work effectively in a multinational setting. This marks a significant milestone for the Philippine Air Force as they gear up for their participation in international military exercises, showcasing their increasing readiness and proficiency in joint operations. Additionally, this opportunity will allow them to demonstrate their skills and capabilities on a global stage, raising the profile of the Philippine Air Force in the international military community.

Summary:

The Philippine Air Force said Balikatan 2024 has helped them prepare for the country"s first ever deployment of aircraft and personnel to an international military exercise.

item.title: House to invite ex-president Duterte adviser in P3-B Pampanga drug bust inquiry
item.content:encoded:
economic adviser, former President Rodrigo Duterte, House of Representatives, P3 billion drug bust, Michael Yang Summary: The House of Representatives plans to invite Michael Yang, an economic adviser to former President Rodrigo Duterte, to the next hearing regarding the P3 billion drug bust in Mexico, Pampanga in 2023. Yang's connection to the drug bust has raised questions, prompting the House to seek his testimony. As a key figure in Duterte's administration, Yang's involvement in the drug bust investigation is significant. His insights and knowledge could provide valuable information to the proceedings. The House aims to gather all relevant parties to shed light on the case and ensure accountability. Yang's presence at the hearing will offer a deeper understanding of the events surrounding the massive drug bust and help in uncovering the truth behind the operation.

Michael Yang, an economic adviser of former President Rodrigo Duterte, will be invited by the House of Representatives to the next hearing in connection with the P3 billion drug bust in Mexico, Pampanga in 2023.

item.title: Marikina"s Marian image pontifically crowned
item.content:encoded:
Bishop Ruperto Santos, Antipolo, Our Lady of Fatima, Diocesan Shrine, Marikina City. Summary: Bishop Ruperto Santos of Antipolo crowned the venerated image of Our Lady of Fatima at the Diocesan Shrine and Parish of St. Paul of the Cross in Marikina City.

Antipolo Bishop Ruperto Santos on Sunday pontifically crowned the venerated image of Our Lady of Fatima at the Diocesan Shrine and Parish of St. Paul of the Cross in Marikina City.

item.title: Kotse nahulog sa tulay sa CamSur; drayber patay, 5 pasahero sugatan
item.content:encoded:
Barangay Apad, Ragay, Camarines Sur, driver, kotse
Summary: In Barangay Apad, Ragay, Camarines Sur, a car driver died after the vehicle fell off a bridge during heavy rain on Sunday morning.

Patay ang driver ng isang kotse makaraan itong mahulog sa isang tulay sa Barangay Apad, Ragay, Camarines Sur sa kasagsagan ng malakas na ulan ng Linggo ng umaga.

item.title: 1 dead, 5 injured after car falls off bridge in Ragay, CamSur
item.content:encoded:
car, bridge, Ragay, Camarines Sur, accident Summary: A tragic incident occurred in the town of Ragay in Camarines Sur on Sunday morning when a car fell off a bridge, resulting in one fatality and five severe injuries. The car plunged off the bridge, causing devastating consequences for the occupants. The precise circumstances leading to the accident remain unclear, leaving authorities to investigate the cause of this unfortunate event. The town of Ragay is left reeling from the aftermath of this tragic incident, as the community mourns the loss of one life and prays for the speedy recovery of the injured individuals. It serves as a stark reminder of the importance of road safety and the need for caution while driving on bridges and other elevated roadways.

Summary:

One person died and five others were severely injured after a car fell off a bridge in the town of Ragay in Camarines Sur on Sunday morning.

item.title: VP Sara underscores mothers" role in nation-building
item.content:encoded:
Mother's Day, Vice President Sara Duterte, gratitude, love, sacrifices Summary: Vice President Sara Duterte commemorated Mother's Day by thanking all mothers for their love and sacrifices. She emphasized the vital role mothers play in creating stronger communities by their selfless dedication. Duterte's message highlighted the significant impact of mothers in shaping society and fostering unity. She expressed appreciation for the tireless efforts and unwavering support of all mothers, recognizing their instrumental role in nurturing families and building a better future. Duterte's sentiments echoed the sentiment shared by many on Mother's Day, recognizing the invaluable contributions of mothers to society. Mothers' love and sacrifices are celebrated and honored for their essential role in shaping communities and spreading compassion and kindness.

Summary:

n celebration of Mother"s Day, Vice President Sara Duterte on Sunday expressed gratitude for her fellow mothers" love and sacrifices, saying that they play an important role in building stronger communities.

item.title: Mandaue City students represent in Int'l Science & Eng'g Fair
item.content:encoded:
Mandaue City Science High School, young scientists, national science contest, International Science and Engineering Fair, USA Summary: Young scientists from Mandaue City Science High School emerged victorious in a national science contest, securing spots at the highly prestigious International Science and Engineering Fair in the USA. Their exceptional performance outshone other competitors, showcasing their undeniable talent and dedication to the field of science. This outstanding achievement highlights the school's commitment to nurturing and empowering young minds in the realm of scientific exploration. The students' success serves as a testament to their hard work and innovative thinking, paving the way for a promising future in the realm of science and technology. Their impressive accomplishment not only reflects their individual skills and knowledge but also brings pride and recognition to their school and community. The opportunity to participate in the international fair will undoubtedly provide them with invaluable experience and the chance to further showcase their expertise on a global scale.

Young scientists from Mandaue City Science High School bested contenders in a national science contest that earned them slots to the International Science and Engineering Fair in the USA.

item.title: Over 5K scouts join jamboree in Balayan
item.content:encoded:
Scouts, Batangas, Jamboree, Balayan, 5,000 Summary: More than 5,000 scouts gathered in Balayan, Batangas for the 26th Batangas Provincial Scout Jamboree. The event attracted a large number of participants from across the province, showcasing the spirit of scouting and camaraderie among the youth. The jamboree provided opportunities for scouts to engage in various activities including team-building exercises, outdoor adventures, and skills development workshops. It was a successful event that highlighted the importance of leadership, teamwork, and community involvement among the scouting community.

More than 5,000 scouts participated in the 26th Batangas Provincial Scout Jamboree held in Balayan, Batangas.

item.title: Labrador, Pangasinan open to nuclear power plant; scientific study pushed
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Labrador, Pangasinan, local government, nuclear power plant, plans Summary: The local government of Labrador, Pangasinan is considering plans to build a nuclear power plant in the town. The proposal has sparked both excitement and concern among the residents. The proponents argue that a nuclear power plant will bring economic development and job opportunities to the area. However, many locals are worried about the potential environmental and safety risks associated with nuclear energy. The government is conducting feasibility studies and consultations to address these concerns and ensure the safety of the community. If the project moves forward, it could significantly impact the town's future and the well-being of its residents. Overall, the decision to build a nuclear power plant in Labrador, Pangasinan is a complex issue that requires careful consideration and thorough assessment of its potential benefits and risks.

Summary: The local government of Labrador, Pangasinan is considering plans to build a nuclear power plant in the town. The proposal has sparked excitement and concern among residents, with proponents citing economic development and job opportunities while locals express worries about environmental and safety risks. Feasibility studies and consultations are ongoing to address these concerns and ensure the community's safety. The decision to proceed with the project could significantly impact the town's future and residents' well-being, underscoring the importance of careful consideration and assessment of its potential benefits and risks.

The local government of Labrador, Pangasinan is considering plans of building a nuclear power plant in the town.

item.title: BI: Tighter visa rules for Chinese tourists to also help ensure national security
item.content:encoded: The Bureau of Immigration said Sunday that tightening the visa requirements for Chinese tourists would also help the Philippines protect national security.

item.title: 9-year-old Bicolano prodigy gains int"l attention
item.content:encoded: A nine-year-old boy from Milaor, Bicol has been making waves internationally with his piano talents, earning numerous medals from international competitions.

item.title: Gunmen kidnap more than 100 in attack on villages in northwest Nigeria
item.content:encoded: More than 100 people were kidnapped by gunmen during Friday night raids on three villages in northwest Nigeria, a district head and residents said on Saturday, the latest abduction of villagers in a region blighted by widespread insecurity.

item.title: Zamboanga eyed as site for impounding facilities, high dams
item.content:encoded: As the country braces for the impending La Niña, the government"s Task Force El Niño is mulling putting up impounding facilities or high dams in select areas.

item.title: Marcos greets First Lady, moms on Mother's Day
item.content:encoded:
Mother's Day, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., message, First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos, heartwarming Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. expressed his heartfelt message to all mothers, including his wife, First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos, on Mother's Day. In his message, he honored the significant role that mothers play in nurturing and caring for their families. He conveyed his appreciation for their unwavering love, dedication, and sacrifices. President Marcos Jr. highlighted the importance of recognizing and celebrating the selfless efforts of mothers in shaping the lives of their children and supporting their loved ones. He acknowledged the essential contributions of mothers in providing comfort, guidance, and strength to their families. The message served as a tribute to all mothers, expressing gratitude for their endless love and devotion in making a positive impact on the lives of those around them.

President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. on Sunday penned a heartwarming message to all mothers, including First Lady Liza Araneta-Marcos, for Mother"s Day.

item.title: Prince Harry speaks of 'brave souls' losing lives in conflict in Nigeria
item.content:encoded:
brave souls, military, conflicts, Nigeria, rehabilitation
Prince Harry visited Nigeria and paid tribute to the brave souls in the country's military who had lost their lives in conflicts. He expressed his admiration for their bravery and sacrifice. He also mentioned feeling "goosebumps" after seeing plans for a new center that would provide rehabilitation for injured troops. The center is expected to offer support and assistance to those who have been wounded in service. Prince Harry's visit highlighted the importance of honoring and supporting military personnel who have dedicated themselves to serving their country. His words of appreciation and support for the military community in Nigeria were well-received and impactful. The new rehabilitation center represents a significant step towards providing essential care and resources for injured troops, demonstrating the commitment to their well-being and recovery.

Summary: Prince Harry visited Nigeria to honor the brave souls in the military who have lost their lives in conflicts and expressed admiration for their sacrifice. He felt "goosebumps" after seeing plans for a new rehabilitation center for injured troops, emphasizing the importance of supporting and honoring military personnel in the country.

Prince Harry spoke in Nigeria on Saturday of the tragic loss of the "brave souls" in the country's military who had lost their lives in conflicts, and said he felt "goosebumps" after seeing plans for a new center to rehabilitate injured troops.

item.title: Marcos creates body to protect human rights in PH
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., special committee, human rights, protection, promotion Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has established a special committee aimed at enhancing human rights protection and promotion within the country. The committee's primary focus is on strengthening the mechanisms in place to safeguard the rights of individuals and ensure their promotion across all sectors. By forming this committee, President Marcos Jr. is demonstrating a commitment to upholding human rights within the country and working towards creating a more inclusive and equitable society. This initiative underscores the importance of prioritizing human rights and acknowledges the need to address any violations or shortcomings in this area. The committee's role is vital in overseeing the implementation of policies and initiatives that will further advance the protection and promotion of human rights, ultimately contributing to a more just and compassionate society for all.

Summary: President Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr. has established a special committee to strengthen human rights protection and promotion in the country. The committee's focus is on enhancing mechanisms for safeguarding rights and ensuring promotion in all sectors, demonstrating a commitment to upholding human rights and creating a more inclusive society. This initiative emphasizes the importance of prioritizing human rights, addressing violations, and overseeing policy implementation to advance human rights protection.

President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. has formed a special committee to further strengthen the human rights protection and promotion in the country.

item.title: Israel orders Palestinians to evacuate from more areas of Gaza's Rafah
item.content:encoded:
evacuate, Palestinians, Rafah, Gaza, humanitarian Summary: Israel has called for Palestinians in more areas of Gaza's southern city of Rafah to evacuate and move to an expanded humanitarian area in Al-Mawasi. The call was made to ensure the safety and well-being of the residents as tensions remain high in the region. The move aims to provide a safer environment for the Palestinians living in the area. Israel's decision comes as part of its efforts to ease the humanitarian crisis in Gaza and provide assistance to those in need. The expanded humanitarian area in Al-Mawasi is seen as a crucial step in ensuring the protection and welfare of the vulnerable population in the region.

Israel called on Saturday for Palestinians in more areas of Gaza's southern city of Rafah to evacuate and head to what it calls an expanded humanitarian area in Al-Mawasi.

item.title: Fierce fighting rages in Ukraine's Kharkiv region as Russia touts gains
item.content:encoded:
fighting, Ukraine, Kharkiv region, villages, Moscow Summary: Fierce fighting between Ukraine and Moscow continued for a second day in the northeastern Kharkiv region, with Moscow claiming to have captured five villages while Kyiv fought to repel the attacks and regain control of the settlements. The conflict has escalated, with both sides engaging in intense battles on the fringes of Kharkiv. The region is a key battleground, with strategic importance for both parties. Despite Moscow's claims of progress, Kyiv remains determined to defend its territories and push back against the advancing forces. The situation remains fluid and volatile, with the outcome of the clashes uncertain. The fighting is a stark reminder of the ongoing conflict between Ukraine and Russia, with implications for the wider region. As the violence continues, the international community watches closely, hoping for a peaceful resolution to the conflict.

Fierce fighting raged into a second day on the fringes of Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv region on Saturday as Moscow said it had captured five villages, while Kyiv said it was repulsing the attacks and battling for control of the settlements.

item.title: 'Carless Sundays' on portion of Roxas Boulevard starts
item.content:encoded:
Portion, Roxas Boulevard, Manila, carless, Sunday
The local government of Manila implemented a carless policy on a portion of Roxas Boulevard on Sundays to promote a healthier lifestyle among residents. This initiative aims to encourage individuals to engage in physical activities such as walking or biking rather than relying on cars for transportation. By restricting vehicle access on Sundays, the government hopes to reduce air pollution and traffic congestion in the area. This move aligns with global efforts to create more sustainable and environmentally friendly cities. Residents are encouraged to take advantage of the car-free zone by participating in outdoor activities and enjoying the promenade along Roxas Boulevard. The carless policy reflects a growing awareness of the importance of promoting wellness and reducing pollution in urban environments.

Summary: The local government of Manila implemented a carless policy on a portion of Roxas Boulevard on Sundays, aiming to promote a healthier lifestyle, reduce air pollution, and alleviate traffic congestion. Residents are encouraged to engage in physical activities and take advantage of the car-free zone to enjoy the outdoor environment. This initiative aligns with global efforts to create more sustainable and environmentally friendly cities, reflecting a growing awareness of the importance of wellness and pollution reduction in urban areas.

A portion of Roxas Boulevard in Manila went carless on Sunday, as the local government said it wanted  residents to be healthier.

item.title: Death toll from floods in Brazil's south climbs to 136
item.content:encoded: The death toll from heavy rains in Brazil's Rio Grande do Sul state has climbed to 136, the local civil defense government body said on Saturday, up from 126 in the previous day, while another 125 people remain unaccounted for.

item.title: Gov't urged to take 'concrete measures' to support Filipino nurses
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Filipino nurses, low wages, long working hours, understaffing, government action Summary: Filipino nurses are facing the challenges of very low wages, long working hours, and understaffing, which is causing them to suffer. The group responsible for addressing the issue is calling on the government to take concrete and decisive measures to improve the situation for these healthcare professionals. It is essential for the government to address the low wages, which are a significant concern for the nurses, as well as the long working hours and understaffing that are contributing to their struggles. By implementing policies that prioritize fair wages, reasonable working hours, and adequate staffing levels, the government can help alleviate the challenges faced by Filipino nurses and improve the overall healthcare system in the country. It is crucial for the government to take action promptly to ensure that Filipino nurses are properly compensated, have reasonable work conditions, and are supported in their efforts to provide quality care to patients.

Summary:

Filipino nurses continue to suffer from ''very low wages,'' long working hours, and understaffing, a group said, as it urged the government to take ''concrete and decisive'' measures to alleviate their situation.

item.title: BI intercepts blacklisted Indian national at NAIA
item.content:encoded:
Immigration, Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3, Indian national, blacklist, prevention Summary: The Bureau of Immigration at Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3 stopped the entry of a blacklisted Indian national. The preventative action was reported by Luisito Santos on Super Radyo dzBB. The individual was denied entry into the country following protocols set forth by the immigration authorities. The enforcement of the blacklist serves as a measure to maintain security and regulate the entry of individuals with prior infractions. The incident underscores the vigilance of immigration officials in upholding immigration laws and ensuring border control. The thwarted entry serves as a reminder of the importance of closely monitoring and enforcing regulations related to immigration and travel.


The Bureau of Immigration recently prevented the entry of a blacklisted Indian national at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport Terminal 3, Luisito Santos reported on Super Radyo dzBB on Saturday.

item.title: Tighter visa rules may deter Chinese tourists, investments - PTAA
item.content:encoded:
PTAA, Philippine, travel agencies, visa rules, Chinese

Summary: The Philippine Travel Agencies Association (PTAA) voiced concerns about the potential negative impact of stricter visa regulations for Chinese tourists visiting the Philippines on the country's economy. The PTAA highlighted the importance of the Chinese market for the tourism industry in the Philippines and expressed worries that tighter visa rules could deter Chinese nationals from visiting, leading to a decline in tourism revenue and overall economic growth. The association emphasized the need for a balance between security measures and facilitating tourist arrivals to ensure the continued growth of the tourism sector in the Philippines.

The Philippine Travel Agencies Association (PTAA) said that tighter visa rules for Chinese nationals visiting the Philippines could have a negative impact on the country's economy.

item.title: Suspek na nanggapos at nanggahasa ng masahista sa Maynila, huli ulit nang mambiktima sa Antipolo
item.content:encoded:
suspect, abduction, gagging, rape, massage Summary: A man who was previously arrested for kidnapping, gagging, and raping a female massage therapist in Manila has been apprehended again for repeating the same crime with another massage therapist in Antipolo City. The suspect is accused of abducting the victims, restraining them, gagging them, and sexually assaulting them during massage sessions. The disturbing pattern of behavior has caused fear and alarm among massage therapists in the area, leading to increased awareness and vigilance. Authorities are investigating the suspect's history and motives to prevent further incidents and ensure the safety of all massage therapists and clients. The repeat offenses highlight the need for stricter regulations and security measures in the massage therapy industry to protect workers and prevent predatory behavior.

Muling hinuli ang lalaking suspek sa panggagapos, pagbusal, at panghahalay ng isang babaeng masahista sa Maynila, matapos siyang mambiktima ulit ng massage therapist sa Antipolo City.

item.title: PH acquires ocean tug to aid ships in WPS
item.content:encoded:
Philippines, ocean tugboat, West Philippine Sea, vessel, assistance Summary: The Philippines has recently acquired an ocean tugboat to provide assistance to vessels in the West Philippine Sea. This new addition strengthens the country's capability to support maritime operations and ensure the safety of ships in the region. The tugboat will play a crucial role in aiding vessels in distress, towing disabled ships, and providing emergency services in the remote and challenging waters of the West Philippine Sea. By enhancing its maritime assets, the Philippines aims to bolster its maritime security and safeguard its national interests in the contested waters. The acquisition of the ocean tugboat demonstrates the country's commitment to upholding its sovereignty and protecting the maritime domain against potential threats. With this new asset in place, the Philippines is better equipped to respond to maritime incidents and support vessels navigating through the strategic waters of the West Philippine Sea.

The Philippines acquired an ocean tugboat that could assist vessels in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: QC court convicts 2 bus drivers in death of journalist Chit Estella
item.content:encoded:
Conviction, Bus drivers, Road mishap, Commonwealth Avenue, Chit Estella Summary: A Quezon City court has convicted the two bus drivers responsible for a road mishap on Commonwealth Avenue that resulted in the death of veteran journalist Chit Estella 13 years ago. The drivers have been found guilty of negligence that led to the fatal accident. The court's decision marks the end of a long legal battle for justice for Estella's family and loved ones. The incident serves as a reminder of the dangers of reckless driving on Philippine roads and the importance of upholding road safety regulations. We hope that this ruling brings some closure to the family of Chit Estella and serves as a warning to other drivers to exercise caution on the road to prevent similar tragedies from occurring in the future.

Summary:

A Quezon City court has convicted the two bus drivers behind the road mishap on Commonwealth Avenue that killed veteran journalist Chit Estella 13 years ago.

item.title: DSWD: Validators to be deployed for food stamp program
item.content:encoded:
DSWD, validators, registration, validation, 300,000 families Summary: The DSWD plans to deploy validators to register and validate 300,000 families for the upcoming launch of the Walang Gutom 2027: Food Stamp Program in July. This initiative aims to provide assistance to targeted families in need of food support. The validators will ensure the accurate registration of beneficiaries, enabling them to access the benefits of the program. The deployment of validators signifies the government's commitment to addressing food insecurity and poverty through effective social welfare programs. The full-scale implementation of the food stamp program is a crucial step towards supporting vulnerable households and ensuring their access to essential nutrition. By preparing for the program's launch, the DSWD is taking proactive measures to alleviate hunger and improve the well-being of Filipino families in need.

The Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) is set to deploy validators for the registration and validation of 300,000 targeted families in preparation of the full-scale implementation of the ''Walang Gutom 2027: Food Stamp Program'' in July.

item.title: UN General Assembly backs Palestinian bid for membership
item.content:encoded: UNITED NATIONS - The United Nations General Assembly on Friday overwhelmingly backed a Palestinian bid to become a full U.N. member by recognizing it as qualified to join and recommending the U.N. Security Council "reconsider the matter favorably."

item.title: Duque to appeal graft raps over purchase of COVID-19 supplies
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Francisco Duque III, motion for reconsideration, Ombudsman, graft charges, COVID-19 supplies Summary: Former health secretary Francisco Duque III plans to file a motion for reconsideration following the Ombudsman's directive to press graft charges against him and former budget undersecretary Christopher Lao. The charges stem from an alleged irregular transfer of more than P41 billion for the acquisition of COVID-19 supplies. Duque intends to challenge the decision and defend himself against the accusations. The Ombudsman's order signifies a potential legal battle for Duque and Lao as they try to navigate the allegations surrounding the procurement process. The case highlights the scrutiny faced by government officials in handling public funds, especially during the pandemic when transparency and accountability are paramount.

Summary:

Former health secretary Francisco Duque III is set to file a motion for reconsideration regarding the Ombudsman's order to file graft charges against him and former budget undersecretary Christopher Lao over the alleged irregular transfer of over P41 billion for the procurement of COVID-19 supplies.

item.title: DOH 'respects" graft raps vs Duque over COVID-19 supply deals
item.content:encoded:
Respected, Ombudsman, graft charges, Francisco Duque III, COVID-19 supplies procurement Summary:

The Department of Health (DOH) has expressed its respect for the Ombudsman's decision to file graft charges against former Secretary Francisco Duque III regarding the alleged irregular transfer of over P41 billion for COVID-19 supplies procurement in 2020. The DOH acknowledged and accepted the Ombudsman's move against Duque, demonstrating their adherence to accountability and transparency in dealing with irregularities and lapses within the department. The charges filed against Duque are a significant development in holding accountable those responsible for any alleged misconduct in utilizing funds earmarked for critical pandemic response efforts. This case highlights the importance of upholding integrity and good governance in handling public funds intended for essential public health measures. The DOH's response signals a commitment to addressing any wrongdoing and ensuring accountability at the highest levels of authority within the department.

Summary:

The DOH said it respected the Ombudsman's decision to file graft charges against former Secretary Francisco Duque III over the alleged irregular transfer of over P41 billion for COVID-19 supplies procurement in 2020.

item.title: Quake and tsunami monitoring center opens in San Fernando, Cebu
item.content:encoded:
DOST-PHIVOLCS, Visayas Cluster Monitoring Center, Earthquake, Tsunami, San Fernando

The DOST-PHIVOLCS has officially launched the PHIVOLCS Visayas Cluster Monitoring Center for Earthquake and Tsunami in San Fernando, south Cebu Province. The new facility aims to enhance monitoring and real-time reporting of seismic activities in the Visayas region, aiding in disaster preparedness and response efforts. The center is equipped with state-of-the-art technology, including seismometers and tsunami detectors, to provide accurate and timely information to local authorities and the public. This initiative underscores the government's commitment to ensuring public safety and reducing the risks associated with natural disasters such as earthquakes and tsunamis. The establishment of the monitoring center in a strategic location like San Fernando is crucial in bolstering the region's resilience and readiness in the face of potential geological hazards. Additionally, the center will serve as a hub for research and education on earthquake and tsunami monitoring, further strengthening disaster resilience in the Visayas.

Summary:

The DOST-PHIVOLCS opened officially the PHIVOLCS Visayas Cluster Monitoring Center for Earthquake and Tsunami in the Municipality of San Fernando, south Cebu Province.

item.title: UAE hits out at Netanyahu for saying Gulf state could help run Gaza
item.content:encoded:
UAE, Israeli Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, Gaza, war Summary: The United Arab Emirates criticized Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for suggesting their involvement in aiding a future government in Gaza. Netanyahu's statement came after a war in the region, implying that the UAE could play a role in Gaza's governance. The UAE government swiftly responded, rejecting any association with providing assistance in Gaza. The comments by Netanyahu were seen as unwelcome and unexpected by the UAE, signaling potential tensions between the two nations. The Gulf state clarified their stance on the matter, emphasizing their commitment to peaceful solutions and distancing themselves from any involvement in Gaza's internal affairs.

Summary:

The United Arab Emirates hit out at Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Saturday after the Israeli leader said the Gulf state could be involved in aiding a future government in Gaza after the war.

item.title: Israel's use of weapons may have violated international law -US
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Biden administration, Israel, US-supplied weapons, international humanitarian law, Gaza Summary: The Biden administration has raised concerns about the use of US-supplied weapons by Israel during its military operation in Gaza, suggesting that it may have violated international humanitarian law. This statement comes as the conflict between Israel and Hamas continues to escalate, with significant civilian casualties and widespread destruction in Gaza. The administration's stance reflects growing international pressure on Israel to exercise restraint and respect human rights in its military actions. The US provides considerable military aid to Israel, and this scrutiny raises questions about the ethical implications of such support. The situation highlights the complexity of US-Israel relations and the challenges of navigating geopolitical conflicts while upholding principles of human rights and international law.

Summary: The Biden administration has expressed concerns over Israel's use of US-supplied weapons in Gaza, suggesting a potential violation of international humanitarian law. The ongoing conflict underscores the delicate balance between supporting allies and upholding human rights standards.

The Biden administration said Israel's use of US-supplied weapons may have violated international humanitarian law during its military operation in Gaza.

item.title: PCG: Dumping of crushed corals in Escoda Shoal may be preps for China island-building
item.content:encoded:
Philippine Coast Guard, crushed corals, Escoda Shoal, China's reclamation activities, Palawan
Summary: The Philippine Coast Guard has raised concerns over the dumping of crushed corals near Escoda (Sabina) Shoal, suspecting that it may be a prelude to China's reclamation activities. The shoal, located closer to Palawan than the disputed Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea, is believed to be targeted for the construction of structures by China. This development raises tensions in the region as territorial disputes continue to escalate. The PCG's observation underscores the strategic importance of maritime features in the South China Sea, especially in the context of China's assertive actions in the area. The potential reclamation activities near Escoda Shoal may have significant implications for the Philippines and other claimant states in the region, necessitating a coordinated response to safeguard maritime security and territorial integrity. The situation highlights the ongoing challenges faced by countries in the region in dealing with China's growing influence and actions in the South China Sea.


The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said Saturday that the dumping of crushed corals near Escoda (Sabina) Shoal may be in preparation for China's reclamation activities to build structures on top of the maritime feature, which is much closer to Palawan than the contested Ayungin Shoal in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Electric posts in Sta. Cruz, Manila fall due to passing truck; road closed
item.content:encoded: A passing truck dragged down some electric posts on Ronquillo Street in Sta. Cruz, Manila on Saturday, blocking the road.

item.title: QCPD files complaint vs. Manibela for May 6 protest vs PUV modernization
item.content:encoded:
police district, complaint, transport group, protest action, PUV Modernization Program Summary:

The Quezon City Police District has filed a complaint against officials of the transport group Manibela for their protest against the PUV Modernization Program on May 6. The officials of Manibela organized the protest action in opposition to the government's program, which aims to modernize public utility vehicles. The transport group's demonstration was seen as a violation of law and order, prompting the police district to take legal action. The complaint filed by the police district reflects the authorities' stance on maintaining peace and order in the community. The protest action, while a form of expression, was deemed to have crossed legal boundaries, leading to the filing of charges against the Manibela officials. This legal action highlights the ongoing tension between transport groups and government initiatives to improve public transportation systems. The outcome of this complaint may have broader implications for future protest actions and the implementation of transportation policies.

Summary:

The Quezon City Police District said it filed a complaint against transport group Manibela officials for their protest action last May 6 against the PUV Modernization Program.

item.title: CHR hopes SC decision on red-tagging 'will fortify adherence to due process'
item.content:encoded:
Supreme Court, Commission on Human Rights, decision, red-tagging, due process Summary: The Commission on Human Rights expressed hope that the Supreme Court decision on red-tagging will strengthen adherence to due process and the rule of law. The decision is expected to have a positive impact on how individuals and groups are treated in legal proceedings related to red-tagging activities. The Commission on Human Rights emphasized the importance of upholding due process and the rule of law in addressing issues related to red-tagging. The decision by the Supreme Court is seen as a significant step towards ensuring that individuals are given fair treatment and protection of their rights in cases involving red-tagging allegations. This development is anticipated to have far-reaching implications for how red-tagging cases are handled in the future.

Summary:

The Commission on Human Rights on Saturday said it is hoping that the Supreme Court decision on red-tagging "will fortify adherence to due process and the rule of law."

item.title: US working to keep Israel, Hamas engaged in Gaza truce efforts
item.content:encoded:
Washington, Israel, Palestinian, Hamas, truce

Washington is attempting to keep Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas involved in Gaza ceasefire efforts, even if only virtually. This comes as a UN agency issues a warning that humanitarian aid supplies in Gaza are running critically low. The agency stated that aid stocks have reached "the bottom of the barrel," emphasizing the urgent need for additional support to alleviate the worsening situation in the beleaguered enclave. Despite the challenges, Washington remains committed to engaging both parties in efforts to maintain peace and stability in the region. As tensions persist and humanitarian conditions deteriorate, international cooperation and support are essential to prevent further escalation of the crisis. The ongoing efforts to facilitate dialogue and negotiation between Israel and Hamas are crucial in establishing a lasting ceasefire and addressing the pressing humanitarian needs of the Gaza population.

Summary:

Washington said it was trying to keep Israel and the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas engaged "if only virtually" in Gaza truce efforts as a UN agency warned that humanitarian aid stocks in the devastated enclave have hit "the bottom of the barrel."

item.title: China on call to expel its diplomats in PH: They should be allowed to do their job
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Chinese, foreign ministry, spokesperson, PH National Security Adviser, diplomats
Summary: The Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson, Lin Jian, criticized Philippine National Security Adviser Eduardo Año for making provocative comments, stating that Chinese diplomats must be allowed to perform their duties. Lin Jian emphasized the importance of diplomats being able to do their job without interference. Año's comments were seen as inflammatory and potentially damaging to diplomatic relations between China and the Philippines. The Chinese government urged for mutual respect and cooperation between the two countries, emphasizing the need for a peaceful and harmonious relationship. Lin Jian's statement highlights the sensitivity and complexity of diplomatic relations between nations, and the need for both parties to communicate and engage in a respectful manner to maintain peace and stability in the region.

Summary:

Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson Lin Jian said comments by PH National Security Adviser Secretary Eduardo Año are provocative and said their diplomats had to be allowed to do their job.

item.title: Kuwait's Emir dissolves parliament, suspends some constitution articles
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Kuwait, Emir, Sheikh Meshal al-Ahmad al-Sabah, dissolved parliament, televised speech Summary: Kuwait's Emir Sheikh Meshal al-Ahmad al-Sabah made a significant announcement in a televised speech on Friday, revealing his decision to dissolve the parliament. This move marks a major development in Kuwait's political landscape. The dissolution of parliament implies that there will be significant changes and potential for a new parliamentary election in the near future. Sheikh Meshal al-Ahmad al-Sabah's decision is likely to have far-reaching implications for the country's political structure and governance. The exact reasons behind the dissolution of parliament were not immediately clear, but it is expected to lead to a period of political transition and uncertainty in Kuwait. The announcement has garnered attention both domestically and internationally, as it signifies a pivotal moment in Kuwait's political history. Overall, the move to dissolve parliament indicates a significant shift in the country's political direction and sets the stage for potential changes in the coming months.

Summary:

Kuwait's Emir Sheikh Meshal al-Ahmad al-Sabah said in a televised speech on Friday that he has dissolved parliament.

item.title: Proposed Manila Bay Dev't Authority may review projects, relocate informal settlers

This agency would work specifically to improve the condition and sustainability of the popular waterfront area. The bill aims to address environmental concerns and ensure the preservation of Manila Bay's natural beauty. item.title: Marlon Tapales, pinasuko sa unang round ang kalabang Thai fighter
item.content:encoded:
Naoya Inoue, Marlon Tapales, Pinoy boxer, WBC Asian Continental super bantamweight belt, Thai

Marlon Tapales proved his worth as a boxer after defeating his Thai opponent in the first round to win the WBC Asian Continental super bantamweight belt. The fight took place at the Midas Hotel and Casino in Pasay on Friday, following Naoya Inoue's victory in December. Tapales showcased his skills and determination by dominating his opponent early on and claiming the title in a convincing fashion. This victory solidifies Tapales's position as a formidable boxer in the super bantamweight division and opens up new opportunities for him in the future. Fans and fellow boxers alike are praising Tapales for his impressive performance and are eager to see what he will achieve next in his boxing career.

Summary:
Marlon Tapales showcased his skills and determination by defeating his Thai opponent in the first round to win the WBC Asian Continental super bantamweight belt. The fight took place at the Midas Hotel and Casino in Pasay, following Naoya Inoue's victory in December. Tapales proved his worth as a boxer and solidified his position as a formidable contender in the super bantamweight division. Fans and fellow boxers are praising Tapales for his impressive performance and are eager to see what he will achieve next in his boxing career.

Matapos paluhurin ni Naoya Inoue noong Disyembre, pinatunayan ng Pinoy boxer na si Marlon Tapales na may ibubuga pa siya matapos pasukuin sa unang round ng kanilang laban ang katunggaling Thai para WBC Asian Continental super bantamweight belt na ginanap nitong Biyernes sa Midas Hotel and Casino sa Pasay.

item.title: Strip search for visitors of inmates halted by BuCor
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: Bureau of Corrections, strip searches, cavity searches, visitors, investigation Summary: The Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) has put a stop to strip and cavity searches for visitors of persons deprived of liberty (PDL) in all prisons and penal farms. This decision comes as investigations into the matter are underway. The temporary halt on these intrusive search methods aims to ensure the rights and dignity of visitors are respected while also maintaining security within the correctional facilities. BuCor's move highlights the importance of balancing security measures with human rights considerations in correctional settings. The decision to suspend strip and cavity searches reflects a commitment to upholding professional standards and proper protocols in handling visitors and maintaining order in prisons. Investigations will shed light on the necessity and impact of these search procedures, potentially leading to reforms in the future. In the meantime, efforts to enhance the visitor experience while ensuring the safety and security of prison facilities are underway.

Summary:

The Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) ordered a halt to the strip and cavity searches for visitors of persons deprived of liberty (PDL) on all prisons and penal farms as investigations are being conducted.

item.title: Passenger from Dubai held at Clark airport for undeclared cellphones
item.content:encoded:
viral, woman, Bureau of Customs, Clark International Airport, cellphone units Summary: A woman who went viral on social media was held by the Bureau of Customs at Clark International Airport. She was found with undeclared cellphone units. The incident sparked widespread attention online as the woman live-streamed her ordeal. The Bureau of Customs detained her for violating customs regulations and failing to declare the phones she brought home. The video of her being held at the airport garnered a significant amount of views and comments, with many expressing shock and disbelief. The woman's actions and the subsequent consequences serve as a reminder to travelers to always declare items properly when entering a country to avoid such situations. The incident sheds light on the importance of abiding by customs regulations and rules when traveling internationally to prevent any legal issues or delays in one's journey.

A woman recently went viral after she went live on social media while being held by the Bureau of Customs at the Clark International Airport for bringing home undeclared cellphone units.

item.title: Household helper facing qualified theft rap in Bacoor
item.content:encoded:
Keywords: authorities, woman, household helper, cash, children Summary: The authorities are searching for a woman who applied for a household helper position but ended up stealing money from the employer's children. The woman used deception to gain access to the household and took advantage of the trust placed in her. The incident highlights the importance of thorough background checks and vetting procedures when hiring domestic help. The children were left vulnerable and their sense of security was shattered by the betrayal of someone they thought they could trust. The woman's actions have consequences not just for the employer and the children, but also for future job applicants in similar positions who may now face increased scrutiny and suspicion. This case serves as a cautionary tale for families seeking household help and underscores the need for vigilance and caution when inviting strangers into the home.

Summary:

The authorities are now looking for a woman who applied to become a household helper but who took the cash of her employer's children.

item.title: Over 200 moms in Dumaguete get free pap smear, breast exams from GMA Kapuso Foundation
item.content:encoded:

The initiative aimed to promote women's health and early detection of potential issues. The event provided accessible healthcare services to women who may not have had the opportunity otherwise. GMA Kapuso Foundation's support contributed to the well-being and empowerment of these mothers, ensuring they have the necessary access to healthcare services. The event highlighted the importance of regular check-ups and screenings for women's health maintenance and disease prevention. Overall, the initiative was a meaningful gesture to show appreciation for mothers while prioritizing their health and well-being.

Ahead of this year"s Mother"s Day, more than 200 mothers in Dumaguete City got free pap smears and breast examinations thanks to GMA Kapuso Foundation.

item.title: 125 elderly PDLs released from prison
item.content:encoded:
Bureau of Corrections, BuCor, elder persons deprived of liberty, National Bilibid Prison, PDLs Summary: The Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) released over 100 elder persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) from the National Bilibid Prison (NBP) and other facilities on Friday. This move aims to address the issue of overcrowding and provide relief to elderly inmates who are more vulnerable to health risks, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. The release of these PDLs is part of BuCor's efforts to manage the prison population and ensure the well-being of inmates. By releasing elderly PDLs, BuCor is also helping reduce the risk of outbreaks within correctional facilities and prevent the spread of diseases. This decision highlights the importance of considering the unique needs of elderly inmates and taking steps to protect their health and safety while in detention.

The Bureau of Corrections (BuCor) on Friday released more than 100 elder persons deprived of liberty (PDLs) from the National Bilibid Prison (NBP) and various operating prisons and penal farms.

item.title: Duque, Lao, pinakakasuhan ng Ombudsman dahil sa P41-B fund transfer sa COVID-19 supplies
